 28229                                  
 28230                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28231                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 28232                                  
 28233                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28234                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 28235                                  
 28236                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 28237                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28238                                  ;
 28239                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 28240                                  ;
 28241                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 28242                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 28243                                  ;
 28244                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 28245                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 28246                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 28247                                  ;
 28248                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 28249                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 28250                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 28251                                  ;
 28252                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 28253                                  ;
 28254                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 28255                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 28256                                  ;           ELSE
 28257                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 28258                                  ;
 28259                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 28260                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 28261                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 28262                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 28263                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 28264                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 28265                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 28266                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 28267                                  ;   allocated.
 28268                                  ;
 28269                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 28270                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 28271                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 28272                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 28273                                  ;
 28274                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 28275                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 28276                                  ;                                                                          ;
 28277                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 28278                                  ;   explanation:
 28279                                  ;
 28280                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 28281                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 28282                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 28283                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 28284                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 28285                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 28286                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 28287                                  ;   the
 28288                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 28289                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 28290                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 28291                                  ;
 28292                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 28293                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 28294                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 28295                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 28296                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 28297                                  ;
 28298                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 28299                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 28300                                  ;                                                                          ;
 28301                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 28302                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 28303                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 28304                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 28305                                  ;
 28306                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 28307                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 28308                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 28309                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 28310                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 28311                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 28312                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 28313                                  ;
 28314                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 28315                                  
 28316                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 28317                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 28318                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 28319                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 28320                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 28321                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 28322                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 28323                                  ;callmagic  endp
 28324                                  
 28325                                  ALLOCATE:
 28326                                  	; 10/09/2018
 28327                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 28328                                  ;
 28329                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 28330                                  ;
 28331                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 28332                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 28333                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 28334                                  ;data would not.
 28335                                  ;        
 28336                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 28337                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 28338                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 28339                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 28340                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 28341                                  
 28342                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28343                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 28344                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 28345                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 28346                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 28347                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 28348                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 28349                                  
 28350                                  ;Regular_Allocate_Path:
 28351                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28352                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 28353                                  
 28354                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28355                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28356                                  
 28357 00004D98 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 28358 00004D99 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 28359 00004D9B E82407                  	call	UNPACK
 28360 00004D9E 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 28361 00004DA2 5B                              POP     BX
 28362 00004DA3 72F2                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 28363                                  
 28364 00004DA5 51                              PUSH    CX
 28365 00004DA6 53                              PUSH    BX
 28366                                  
 28367 00004DA7 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 28368                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 28369                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 28370 00004DA9 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 28371 00004DAD 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 28372 00004DB0 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 28373                                  
 28374                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 28375                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 28376                                  
 28377                                  ads1:
 28378                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28379                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 28380 00004DB2 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 28381 00004DB8 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 28382                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 28383                                  
 28384                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 28385                                  ;
 28386                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 28387                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 28388                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 28389                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 28390                                  
 28391                                  FINDFRE:
 28392 00004DBB 43                              INC     BX
 28393                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 28394 00004DBC 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 28395 00004DC0 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 28396 00004DC2 E8FD06                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 28397 00004DC5 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 28398 00004DC7 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 28399                                  
 28400                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 28401                                  ;
 28402                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 28403                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 28404                                  
 28405                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 28406                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 28407 00004DC9 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 28408 00004DCD 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 28409 00004DCE BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 28410 00004DD1 E84207                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 28411 00004DD4 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 28412                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 28413                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 28414 00004DD6 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 28415 00004DDB 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 28416                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 28417                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 28418 00004DDD 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 28419                                  NO_ALLOC:
 28420 00004DE1 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 28421 00004DE2 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 28422 00004DE4 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 28423 00004DE6 E82D07                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 28424                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 28425                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 28426 00004DE9 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 28427 00004DEB 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 28428 00004DEC 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 28429 00004DEE E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 28430                                  
 28431                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 28432                                  ;
 28433                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 28434                                  
 28435 00004DF0 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 28436 00004DF3 E82007                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 28437                                  
 28438                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 28439                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 28440                                  ;
 28441                                  ;       'C' set if error
 28442                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 28443                                  
 28444                                  ads4:   
 28445 00004DF6 5B                      	POP     BX
 28446 00004DF7 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 28447 00004DF8 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 28448 00004DFA E8C506                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 28449                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 28450 00004DFD 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 28451 00004DFF E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 28452 00004E02 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 28453 00004E04 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 28454 00004E06 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 28455 00004E08 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 28456                                  
 28457                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 28458                                  ;   info
 28459                                  dofastk:
 28460                                  	; 20/05/2019
 28461                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28462                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 28463                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 28464                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 28465                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 28466

 28468                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28469

 28471                                  	;push	dx ; *

 28479                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 28480 00004E0F 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX

 28488

 28491                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 28492                                  
 28493 00004E18 C3                      	retn	
 28494                                  
 28495                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 28496                                  ;   of the disk...
 28497                                  
 28498                                  ads7:   
 28499 00004E19 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 28500 00004E1E 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 28501                                  
 28502                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 28503                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 28504                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 28505                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 28506                                  ;
 28507                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 28508                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 28509                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 28510                                  
 28511 00004E20 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 28512 00004E21 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 28513 00004E24 E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 28514 00004E27 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 28515                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 28516                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 28517                                                                  ;   setup.
 28518 00004E28 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 28519 00004E2A E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 28520                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 28521                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 28522                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 28523 00004E2D C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 28524 00004E32 F9                              STC
 28525 00004E33 C3                              retn

 28527                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28528                                  ;
 28529                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 28530                                  ;
 28531                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 28532                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28533                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28534                                  
 28535                                  RESTFATBYT:
 28536 00004E34 53                              PUSH    BX
 28537 00004E35 52                              PUSH    DX
 28538 00004E36 57                              PUSH    DI
 28539 00004E37 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 28540 00004E39 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 28541 00004E3D E8D606                  	call	PACK
 28542 00004E40 5F                              POP     DI
 28543 00004E41 5A                              POP     DX
 28544 00004E42 5B                              POP     BX
 28545                                  ; 16/12/2022
 28546                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28547                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 28548 00004E43 C3                      	retn
 28549                                  
 28550                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 28551                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28552                                  ;
 28553                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 28554                                  ;
 28555                                  ; Inputs:
 28556                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 28557                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 28558                                  ; Function:
 28559                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 28560                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28561                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 28562                                  ;
 28563                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28564                                  
 28565                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28566                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28567                                  RELEASE:
 28568 00004E44 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 28569                                  
 28570                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 28571                                  RELBLKS:
 28572                                  
 28573                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 28574                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 28575                                  
 28576 00004E46 E87906                  	call	UNPACK
 28577 00004E49 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 28578 00004E4B 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 28579 00004E4D 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 28580 00004E4F 52                              PUSH    DX
 28581 00004E50 E8C306                  	call	PACK
 28582 00004E53 5A                              POP     DX
 28583 00004E54 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 28584 00004E56 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 28585 00004E58 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 28586                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28587                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 28588 00004E5A 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 28589 00004E5F 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 28590 00004E61 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 28591                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 28592 00004E65 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 28593 00004E67 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 28594 00004E68 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 28595 00004E6A E83E06                  	call	IsEOF
 28596 00004E6D 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 28597                                  
 28598                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28599                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28600                                  ;%if 0
 28601                                  RELEASE_flush:
 28602                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28603 00004E6F 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 28604                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 28605 00004E73 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 28606 00004E74 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 28607 00004E75 06                      	push	es
 28608 00004E76 55                      	push	bp
 28609 00004E77 E8570B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 28610 00004E7A 5D                      	pop	bp
 28611 00004E7B 07                      	pop	es
 28612 00004E7C 59                      	pop	cx
 28613 00004E7D 5E                      	pop	si
 28614                                  ;%endif
 28615                                  RET12:
 28616 00004E7E C3                      	retn
 28617                                  
 28618                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 28619                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28620                                  ;
 28621                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 28622                                  ;
 28623                                  ; Inputs:
 28624                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 28625                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 28626                                  ;       DS = CS
 28627                                  ; Outputs:
 28628                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 28629                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28630                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 28631                                  ;
 28632                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28633                                  
 28634                                  GETEOF:
 28635 00004E7F E84006                  	call	UNPACK
 28636 00004E82 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 28637 00004E84 53                              PUSH    BX
 28638 00004E85 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28639 00004E87 E82106                  	call	IsEOF
 28640 00004E8A 5B                              POP     BX
 28641 00004E8B 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 28642 00004E8D 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28643 00004E8F EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF
 28644                                  
 28645                                  ;============================================================================
 28646                                  ; FCB.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28647                                  ;============================================================================
 28648                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28649                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28650                                  
 28651                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 28652                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 28653                                  
 28654                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 28655                                  ;		  filename characters
 28656                                  ;
 28657                                  ;	MakeFcb
 28658                                  ;	NameTrans
 28659                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 28660                                  ;	GetLet
 28661                                  ;	UCase
 28662                                  ;	GetLet3
 28663                                  ;	GetCharType
 28664                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 28665                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 28666                                  ;	DELIM
 28667                                  ;
 28668                                  ;	Revision history:
 28669                                  ;
 28670                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 28671                                  ;	
 28672                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 28673                                  
 28674                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 28675                                  
 28676                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 28677                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 28678                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 28679                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 28680                                  
 28681                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28682                                  ;
 28683                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 28684                                  ;
 28685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28686                                  
 28687                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28688                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28689                                  MAKEFCB:
 28690                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28691 00004E91 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 28692 00004E97 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 28693                                  	;test	al,2
 28694 00004E99 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 28695 00004E9B 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 28696 00004E9D 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 28697                                  DEFDRV:
 28698 00004EA1 47                      	INC	DI
 28699 00004EA2 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 28700                                  	;test	al,4
 28701 00004EA5 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 28702 00004EA7 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 28703 00004EA8 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 28704 00004EAA 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 28705 00004EAC 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28706 00004EAE 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 28707                                  FILLB:
 28708 00004EB0 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28709 00004EB2 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 28710 00004EB4 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 28711 00004EB7 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 28712 00004EB9 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28713 00004EBB 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 28714                                  FILLB2:
 28715 00004EBD F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28716 00004EBF 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 28717 00004EC0 AB                      	STOSW
 28718 00004EC1 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 28719 00004EC2 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 28720                                  	;test	bl,1
 28721 00004EC5 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 28722 00004EC8 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 28723 00004ECA E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 28724 00004ECD E82201                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 28725 00004ED0 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 28726 00004ED2 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 28727                                  SKPSPC:
 28728 00004ED3 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 28729                                  NOSCAN:
 28730 00004ED6 E8F000                  	CALL	GETLET
 28731 00004ED9 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 28732 00004EDB 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 28733 00004EDE 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 28734 00004EE0 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 28735 00004EE1 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 28736 00004EE3 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 28737                                  
 28738 00004EE5 50                      	PUSH	AX
 28739 00004EE6 E8161B                  	call	GetVisDrv
 28740 00004EE9 58                      	POP	AX
 28741 00004EEA 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 28742                                  
 28743                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28744                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28745                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28746 00004EEC 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 28747                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 28748 00004EF2 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 28749                                  BADDRV:
 28750 00004EF4 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 28751                                  HAVDRV:
 28752 00004EF6 AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 28753 00004EF7 46                      	INC	SI
 28754 00004EF8 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 28755                                  NODRV:
 28756 00004EF9 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 28757 00004EFA 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 28758                                  
 28759                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 28760                                  NORMSCAN:
 28761 00004EFB B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 28762 00004EFE E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 28763 00004F01 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 28764 00004F04 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 28765 00004F06 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 28766                                  
 28767                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28768                                  	;mov	cx,3
 28769 00004F07 B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 28770                                  
 28771                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28772                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28773                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 28774                                  	; 10/06/2019
 28775 00004F09 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 28776 00004F0F 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 28777 00004F11 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 28778                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28779                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 28780 00004F12 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 28781                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 28782                                  VOLOK:
 28783                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 28784                                  contvol:
 28785 00004F13 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 28786                                  NODOT:
 28787 00004F16 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 28788                                  
 28789                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28790                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 28791                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28792 00004F18 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 28793                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 28794                                  
 28795 00004F1E C3                      	retn
 28796                                  
 28797                                  NONAM:
 28798 00004F1F 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28799 00004F21 4E                      	DEC	SI
 28800 00004F22 C3                      	retn
 28801                                  
 28802                                  GETWORD:
 28803 00004F23 E8A300                  	CALL	GETLET		
 28804 00004F26 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 28805 00004F28 4E                      	DEC	SI
 28806                                  
 28807                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 28808                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 28809                                  
 28810                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 28811 00004F29 E89D00                  	CALL	GETLET
 28812                                  
 28813                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 28814                                  
 28815                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 28816                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 28817                                  ;ENDIF
 28818 00004F2C 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 28819                                  
 28820                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28821 00004F2E 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 28822 00004F34 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 28823 00004F36 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 28824 00004F38 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 28825                                  
 28826                                  MustCheckCX:
 28827 00004F3A E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 28828 00004F3C 49                      	DEC	CX
 28829 00004F3D 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 28830 00004F3F 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 28831 00004F41 B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 28832 00004F43 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28833                                  NOSTAR:
 28834 00004F45 AA                      	STOSB
 28835 00004F46 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 28836 00004F48 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 28837 00004F4A 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 28838 00004F4D EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 28839                                  FILLNAM:
 28840 00004F4F B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 28841 00004F51 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28842 00004F53 4E                      	DEC	SI
 28843 00004F54 C3                      	retn
 28844                                  
 28845                                  SCANB:
 28846 00004F55 AC                      	LODSB
 28847 00004F56 E8A100                  	CALL	SPCHK
 28848 00004F59 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 28849 00004F5B 4E                      	DEC	SI
 28850                                  scanb_retn:
 28851 00004F5C C3                      	retn
 28852                                  
 28853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28854                                  ;
 28855                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 28856                                  ;
 28857                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 28858                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 28859                                  ;
 28860                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 28861                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 28862                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 28863                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 28864                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 28865                                  ;
 28866                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28867                                  
 28868                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28869                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28870                                  NameTrans:
 28871                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28872 00004F5D 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 28873 00004F63 16                      	push	ss
 28874 00004F64 07                      	pop	es
 28875                                  
 28876                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28877 00004F65 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28878 00004F68 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28879 00004F69 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 28880 00004F6C B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 28881 00004F6F AA                      	STOSB
 28882 00004F70 F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 28883 00004F72 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 28884 00004F74 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 28885 00004F76 AA                      	STOSB
 28886 00004F77 5F                      	POP	DI
 28887                                  
 28888 00004F78 E880FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 28889                                  
 28890                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 28891 00004F7B 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 28892 00004F81 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 28893 00004F83 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 28894 00004F89 C3                      	retn
 28895                                  
 28896                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 28897                                  ;============================================================================
 28898                                  
 28899                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28900                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 28901                                  
 28902                                  ;If TableLook
 28903                                  
 28904                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 28905                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 28906                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28907                                  
 28908                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 28909                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 28910                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 28911                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 28912                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 28913                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 28914                                  
 28915                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 28916                                  ;CharType:
 28917                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28918                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 28919                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28920                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 28921                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28922                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 28923                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28924                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 28925                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28926                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 28927                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28928                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 28929                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28930                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 28931                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28932                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 28933                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28934                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 28935                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28936                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 28937                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28938                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 28939                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28940                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 28941                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28942                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 28943                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28944                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28946                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 28947                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28948                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 28949                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 28950                                  ;	      ; # and "
 28951                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 28952                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 28953                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 28954                                  ;	      ; + and *
 28955                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28956                                  ;	      ; - and '
 28957                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 28958                                  ;	      ; / and .
 28959                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28960                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 28961                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 28962                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 28963                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28964                                  ;	      ; = and <
 28965                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28966                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 28967                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28968                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 28969                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 28970                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 28971                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28972                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 28973                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28974                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 28975                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 28976                                  ;	      ; } and |
 28977                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28978                                  
 28979                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 28980                                  ;					; character in the table
 28981                                  
 28982                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 28983                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 28984                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 28985                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 28986                                  
 28987                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 28988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28989                                  ; DOSCODE:8F76h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28990                                  
 28991                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 28992 00004F8A 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 28993 00004F92 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 28994 00004F9A F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23
 28995 00004FA2 FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31
 28996 00004FAA FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 32-39
 28997 00004FB2 FFFFFFFFFF6F66FF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 6Fh, 66h,0FFh ; 40-47
 28998 00004FBA FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 48-55
 28999 00004FC2 FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62
 29000                                  
 29001                                  CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2
 29002                                  
 29003                                  ; Offset 12CAh of IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
 29004                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29005                                  ;CharType:
 29006                                  ;       db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29007                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F0h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29008                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29009                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 29010                                  ;	db 0F8h,0FFh,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29011                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0F4h,0FFh,0FEh,0F6h
 29012                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29013                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0F4h,0FFh
 29014                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29015                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29016                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29017                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh
 29018                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29019                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29020                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29021                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29022                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29023                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29024                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29025                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29026                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29027                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29028                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29029                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29030                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29031                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29032                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29033                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29034                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29035                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29036                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29037                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh
 29038                                  
 29039                                  ;hkn; Table	ENDS
 29040                                  
 29041                                  ;ENDIF
 29042                                  
 29043                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29044                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29045                                  
 29046                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29047                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29048                                  
 29049                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29050                                  ;
 29051                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 29052                                  ;
 29053                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 29054                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 29055                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 29056                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 29057                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 29058                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 29059                                  ;
 29060                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 29061                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 29062                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 29063                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 29064                                  ;
 29065                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 29066                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 29067                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 29068                                  ;
 29069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29070                                  
 29071                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 29072                                  
 29073                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 29074                                  GETLET:	
 29075 00004FC9 AC                      	LODSB
 29076                                  
 29077                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 29078                                  
 29079                                  	;entry	UCase
 29080                                  UCase:	
 29081                                  	; 09/08/2018
 29082                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 29083                                  _UCase:
 29084 00004FCA 53                      	PUSH	BX
 29085 00004FCB BB[310B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 29086                                  
 29087                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 29088                                  
 29089                                  gl_0:
 29090 00004FCE 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 29091 00004FD0 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 29092 00004FD2 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 29093 00004FD4 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 29094 00004FD6 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 29095                                  
 29096                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 29097                                  
 29098                                  gl_1:
 29099 00004FD8 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 29100 00004FDA 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 29101 00004FDC 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 29102                                  
 29103                                  	; M048 - Start 
 29104                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 29105                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 29106                                  	; preserve it.
 29107                                  
 29108                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29109                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29110                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 29111                                  	;CS	XLAT
 29112                                  
 29113                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29114                                  
 29115                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29116 00004FDE 1E                      	push	ds
 29117                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 29118 00004FDF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29119 00004FE4 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 29120 00004FE5 1F                      	pop	ds
 29121                                  
 29122                                  	; M048 - End
 29123                                  
 29124                                  ; Now check the type
 29125                                  
 29126                                  ;If TableLook
 29127                                  gl_2:
 29128                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29129 00004FE6 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29130                                  
 29131                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29132                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 29133                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 29134                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 29135                                  	;cs	xlat	
 29136                                  	
 29137                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29138 00004FE7 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 29139                                  	
 29140                                  	;test	al,1	
 29141 00004FEA A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 29142 00004FEC 58                      	POP	AX
 29143 00004FED 5B                      	POP	BX
 29144 00004FEE C3                      	RETN
 29145                                  
 29146                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 29147                                  
 29148                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29149                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 29150                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 29151 00004FEF 53                      	PUSH	BX
 29152 00004FF0 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 29153                                  ;ELSE
 29154                                  ;
 29155                                  ;gl_2:
 29156                                  ;	POP	BX
 29157                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 29158                                  ;	retz
 29159                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 29160                                  ;	retz
 29161                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 29162                                  ;	retz
 29163                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 29164                                  ;	retz
 29165                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 29166                                  ;	retz
 29167                                  ;ENDIF
 29168                                  
 29169                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29170                                  ;
 29171                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 29172                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 29173                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 29174                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 29175                                  ;
 29176                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 29177                                  
 29178                                  	;entry	DELIM
 29179                                  DELIM:
 29180                                  ;IF TableLook
 29181                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29182 00004FF2 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29183                                  
 29184                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29185                                  	;push	bx
 29186                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 29187                                  	;;09/08/2018
 29188                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 29189                                  	;cs	xlat
 29190                                  	;pop	bx
 29191                                  
 29192                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29193 00004FF3 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 29194                                  	
 29195                                  	;test	al,2
 29196 00004FF6 A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 29197 00004FF8 58                      	POP	AX
 29198 00004FF9 C3                      	RETN
 29199                                  ;ELSE
 29200                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 29201                                  ;	retz
 29202                                  ;
 29203                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 29204                                  ;	retz
 29205                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 29206                                  ;	retz
 29207                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 29208                                  ;	retz
 29209                                  ;
 29210                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 29211                                  ;	retz
 29212                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 29213                                  ;	retz
 29214                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 29215                                  ;	retz
 29216                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 29217                                  ;	retz
 29218                                  ;ENDIF
 29219                                  
 29220                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29221                                  ;
 29222                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 29223                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 29224                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 29225                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 29226                                  ;
 29227                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29228                                  
 29229                                  	;entry SPCHK
 29230                                  SPCHK:
 29231                                  ;IF TableLook
 29232                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29233 00004FFA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29234                                  
 29235                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29236                                  	;push	bx
 29237                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 29238                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 29239                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 29240                                  	;cs	xlat
 29241                                  	;pop	bx
 29242                                  
 29243                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29244 00004FFB E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 29245                                  	
 29246                                  	;test	al,4
 29247 00004FFE A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 29248 00005000 58                      	POP	AX
 29249 00005001 C3                      	RETN
 29250                                  ;ELSE
 29251                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 29252                                  ;	retz
 29253                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 29254                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 29255                                  ;	return
 29256                                  ;ENDIF

 29258                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29259                                  ;
 29260                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 29261                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 29262                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 29263                                  ;
 29264                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 29265                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 29266                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 29267                                  ;
 29268                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29269                                  
 29270                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29271                                  
 29272                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29273                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29274                                  GetCharType:
 29275                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 29276 00005002 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 29277 00005004 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 29278                                  
 29279 00005006 53                      	push	bx
 29280 00005007 BB[8A4F]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 29281 0000500A D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 29282                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 29283 0000500C 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 29284 0000500E 5B                      	pop	bx
 29285                                  
 29286                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 29287                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 29288                                  
 29289 0000500F 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 29290                                  
 29291 00005011 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 29292 00005013 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 29293 00005015 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 29294 00005017 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 29295                                  gct_80:
 29296 00005019 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 29297 0000501B C3                      	retn
 29298                                  gct_90:
 29299 0000501C B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 29300 0000501E C3                      	retn
 29301

 29313                                  GotFor:
 29314 00005026 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 29315 00005028 C3                      	retn
 29316                                  PathRet:
 29317 00005029 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 29318 0000502B C3                      	retn

 29329                                  
 29330                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 29331                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 29332                                  
 29333                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 29334                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 29335                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 29336                                  ;
 29337                                  ;	FATAL
 29338                                  ;	FATAL1
 29339                                  ;	reset_environment
 29340                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK

 29343                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 29344                                  ;	DIVOV
 29345                                  ;	CHARHARD
 29346                                  ;	HardErr
 29347                                  ;
 29348                                  ;	Revision history:
 29349                                  ;
 29350                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 29351                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 29352                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 29353                                  ;
 29354                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 29355                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 29356                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 29357                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 29358                                  ;
 29359                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 29360                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 29361                                  ;	      charhard.

 29532                                  ;
 29533                                  ; Procedure Name : SpoolInt
 29534                                  ;
 29535                                  ; SpoolInt - signal processes that the DOS is truly idle. We are allowed to
 29536                                  ; do this ONLY if we are working on a 1-12 system call AND if we are not in
 29537                                  ; the middle of an INT 24.
 29538                                  ;
 29539                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29540                                  
 29541                                  SPOOLINT:
 29542 000050BB 9C                              PUSHF
 29543                                  	; 15/03/2018
 29544 000050BC 36803E[5803]00                  CMP     BYTE [SS:IDLEINT],0	; SS override
 29545 000050C2 7423                            JZ      SHORT POPFRET
 29546 000050C4 36803E[2003]00                  CMP     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0
 29547 000050CA 751B                            JNZ     SHORT POPFRET		;No spool ints in error mode
 29548                                  
 29549                                  	; 30/07/2018
 29550                                  
 29551                                  	; Note that we are going to allow an external program to issue system 
 29552                                  	; calls at this time. We MUST preserve IdleInt across this.
 29553                                  
 29554 000050CC 36FF36[5803]            	PUSH	WORD [SS:IDLEINT]
 29555                                  
 29556                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29557                                   
 29558                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29559 000050D1 36803E[F711]00          	cmp	byte [SS:DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 29560 000050D7 7504                    	jne	short do_low_int28	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 29561 000050D9 CD28                    	INT	int_spooler  ; int 28h 	; N: Execute user int 28 handler
 29562 000050DB EB05                    	jmp	short spool_ret_addr
 29563                                  
 29564                                  do_low_int28:
 29565                                  	;call	far [ss:LowInt28Addr]
 29566 000050DD 2EFF1E[3450]            	call	far [cs:LowInt28Addr]	; 05/05/2019
 29567                                  
 29568                                  spool_ret_addr:
 29569                                  	;INT	int_spooler		; INT 28h
 29570                                  
 29571 000050E2 368F06[5803]            	POP	WORD [SS:IDLEINT]
 29572                                  POPFRET:
 29573 000050E7 9D                              POPF
 29574                                  _RET18:  
 29575 000050E8 C3                      	RETN
