 29705                                  
 29706                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29707                                  ;
 29708                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 29709                                  ;
 29710                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 29711                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 29712                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 29713                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 29714                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 29715                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 29716                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 29717                                  ; is simulated.
 29718                                  ;
 29719                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29720                                  
 29721                                  CNTCHAND:
 29722                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 29723                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 29724                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 29725                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29726                                  
 29727                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29728                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 29729 00005176 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 29730 0000517C 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29731                                  
 29732 0000517E B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 29733 00005180 E874C5                          CALL	BUFOUT
 29734 00005183 E812C4                          CALL	CRLF
 29735                                  around_deadlock:
 29736 00005186 16                              PUSH    SS
 29737 00005187 1F                              POP     DS
 29738 00005188 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 29739 0000518D 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 29740 0000518F E8B5E0                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 29741                                  NOSWAP:
 29742 00005192 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 29743 00005193 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 29744 00005197 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 29745 0000519B E8B1B2                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 29746                                  
 29747                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 29748                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 29749                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 29750                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 29751                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 29752                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 29753                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 29754                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29755                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 29756                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 29757                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 29758                                  			; else
 29759                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 29760                                  
 29761                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29762                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 29763                                  
 29764                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 29765                                  	
 29766 0000519E 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 29767                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 29768 0000519F 1E                      	push	ds
 29769                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29770 000051A0 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29771 000051A5 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 29772 000051AA C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 29773 000051AF 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 29774                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 29775 000051B3 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 29776                                  
 29777 000051B8 803E[F711]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 29778 000051BD 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 29779 000051BE 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 29780 000051C0 F8                      	CLC				
 29781 000051C1 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29782 000051C3 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 29783                                  
 29784                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29785                                  do_low_int23:
 29786 000051C5 F8                      	clc
 29787 000051C6 2EFF1E[2C50]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 29788                                  
 29789                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 29790                                  
 29791                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 29792                                  
 29793                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 29794                                  ;
 29795                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 29796                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 29797                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 29798                                  ;
 29799                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 29800                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 29801

 29803

 29805

 29821 000051D7 58                      	pop	ax

 29827

 29837

 29847                                  COMMANDJ:

 29849

 29851                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 29852

 29855                                  	;;test	ax,1

 29859                                  
 29860                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 30062                                  ;
 30063                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 30064                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 30065                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 30066                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 30067                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 30068                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 30069                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30070                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 30071                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 30072                                  ; Output:
 30073                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 30074                                  ;
 30075                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30077                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 30342                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30343                                  ;
 30344                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 30345                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 30346                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 30347                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 30348                                  ;
 30349                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 30350                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 30351                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 30352                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 30353                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 30354                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 30355                                  ;
 30356                                  ; output:   none.
 30357                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30358                                  
 30359                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 30360                                  	
 30361                                  reset_environment:

 30368

 30516                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30517                                  ;
 30518                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 30519                                  ;
 30520                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 30521                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 30522                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 30523                                  ;
 30524                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30525                                  
 30526                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 30527 00005484 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30528                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 30529 00005485 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 30530 00005488 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 30531                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 30532                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 30533                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30534                                  	
 30535                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30536 0000548B 1E                      	push	ds
 30537                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 30538 0000548C 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 30539                                  
 30540                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate 
 30541                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 30542                                  
 30543 00005491 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 30544 00005493 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 30545 00005495 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 30546                                  
 30547                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30548 00005497 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30549 0000549B 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 30550                                  NoTrans:
 30551                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 30552 0000549D A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 30553 000054A0 1F                      	pop	ds
 30554                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 30555 000054A1 58                      	POP	AX
 30556                                  
 30557                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct 
 30558                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 30559                                  
 30560 000054A2 56                      	PUSH	SI
 30561                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 30562 000054A3 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 30563 000054A6 E8D5B1                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 30564 000054A9 5E                      	POP	SI
 30565 000054AA C3                      	retn
 30566                                  
 30567                                  ;============================================================================
 30568                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 30569                                  ;============================================================================
 30570                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30571                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30572                                  
 30573                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 30574                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 30575                                  
 30576                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 30577                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30578                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 30579                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 30580                                  ;
 30581                                  ;	IsEof
 30582                                  ;	UNPACK
 30583                                  ;	PACK
 30584                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 30585                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 30586                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 30587                                  ;	FAT_operation
 30588                                  ;
 30589                                  ;	Revision history:
 30590                                  ;
 30591                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 30592                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 30593                                  ;
 30594                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 30595                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 30596                                  
 30597                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30598                                  
 30599                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 30600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30601                                  ;
 30602                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 30603                                  ;
 30604                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 30605                                  ;
 30606                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 30607                                  ;		BX has fat value
 30608                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 30609                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 30610                                  ;
 30611                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30612                                  
 30613                                  IsEOF:
 30614                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 30615 000054AB 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 30616 000054B1 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 30617                                  
 30618                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 30619                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 30620                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 30621                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 30622                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 30623                                  
 30624 000054B3 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 30625 000054B7 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 30626                                  
 30627 000054B9 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 30628                                  IsEOF_other:
 30629 000054BD C3                      	retn
 30630                                  EOF16:
 30631 000054BE 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 30632 000054C1 C3                      	retn
 30633                                  
 30634                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30635                                  
 30636                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 30637                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30638                                  ;
 30639                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 30640                                  ;
 30641                                  ; Inputs:
 30642                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 30643                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30644                                  ; Outputs:
 30645                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 30646                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 30647                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30648                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 30649                                  ;
 30650                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 30651                                  ;
 30652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30653                                  	
 30654                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30655                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30656                                  
 30657                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30658                                  UNPACK:
 30659                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 30660 000054C2 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 30661 000054C4 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 30662 000054C6 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 30663 000054CA 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 30664 000054CC C3                      	retn				; done
 30665                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 30666                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30667                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 30668 000054CD 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 30669 000054D1 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 30670 000054D3 E8D600                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30671 000054D6 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 30672 000054D8 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 30673 000054DA 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 30674 000054DC 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30675 000054E0 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 30676 000054E4 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 30677 000054E6 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 30678 000054E8 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 30679                                  High12:
 30680 000054EA D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30681 000054EC D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30682 000054EE D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30683 000054F0 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30684                                  Unpack12:
 30685 000054F2 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 30686                                  _DoContext:
 30687 000054F6 16                      	PUSH	SS
 30688 000054F7 1F                      	POP	DS
 30689 000054F8 C3                      	retn
 30690                                  HURTFAT:
 30691                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 30692                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30693 000054F9 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30694 000054FF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30695 00005500 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 30696                                  
 30697                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30698 00005502 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 30699                                  ;
 30700                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 30701                                  ;
 30702 00005508 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 30703 0000550B E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 30704 0000550E 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30705 00005510 F8                      	CLC
 30706 00005511 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 30707 00005513 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 30708                                  OKU_RET:
 30709 00005514 58                      	POP	AX
 30710                                  hurtfat_retn:
 30711 00005515 C3                      	retn
 30712                                  
 30713                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30714                                  
 30715                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 30716                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30717                                  ;
 30718                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 30719                                  ;
 30720                                  ; Inputs:
 30721                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 30722                                  ;	DX = Data
 30723                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 30724                                  ; Outputs:
 30725                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 30726                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 30727                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30728                                  ;	No other registers affected
 30729                                  ;
 30730                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 30731                                  ;
 30732                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30733                                  
 30734                                  	; 02/01/2024
 30735                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30736                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30737                                  PACK:
 30738                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 30739 00005516 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 30740 00005518 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 30741 0000551A 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 30742 0000551E C3                      	retn				; done
 30743                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 30744                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30745 0000551F E88A00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30746 00005522 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 30747 00005524 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 30748 00005526 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 30749 00005528 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 30750 00005529 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 30751 0000552B D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 30752 0000552D 59                      	POP	CX
 30753 0000552E 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 30754 00005531 EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 30755                                  ALIGNED:
 30756                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 30757 00005533 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 30758 00005539 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 30759 0000553B 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 30760 0000553F 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 30761 00005543 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 30762                                  Pack16:
 30763 00005545 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 30764                                  PACKIN:
 30765 00005547 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 30766 00005549 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 30767                                  
 30768                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30769 0000554B 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 30770                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30771 00005550 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30772                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30773 00005554 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30774                                  	; 10/06/2019
 30775 00005556 E87D05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30776                                  	
 30777                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 30778 00005559 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30779                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 30780                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30781 0000555D 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 30782                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30783 00005563 16                      	push	ss
 30784 00005564 1F                      	pop	ds
 30785 00005565 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 30786 00005567 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30787 00005568 53                      	PUSH	BX
 30788 00005569 51                      	PUSH	CX
 30789 0000556A A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 30790 0000556D 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 30791                                  	;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 30792                                  	;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30793 00005571 83C614                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 30794 00005574 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 30795                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30796                                  	;Context DS
 30797 00005576 16                      	push	ss
 30798 00005577 1F                      	pop	ds
 30799                                  	
 30800 00005578 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30801                                  	
 30802                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30803 00005579 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30804 0000557D 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30805                                  
 30806                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30807 00005581 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 30808                                  
 30809                                  	;MOV	SI,1	  ; *
 30810                                  	;XOR	AL,AL     ; *
 30811                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB ; *
 30812                                  	; 22/09/2023
 30813 00005585 E83E03                  	call	GETBUFFRA ; *
 30814                                  
 30815 00005588 58                      	POP	AX
 30816 00005589 721B                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 30817 0000558B C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 30818                                  	
 30819                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30820 0000558F F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30821                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30822 00005593 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30823 00005595 E83E05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30824                                  	
 30825                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 30826 00005598 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 30827                                  yesdirty12:
 30828                                  	;;add	di,16
 30829                                  	;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30830                                  	; 02/01/2024
 30831                                  	;ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 30832                                  	;DEC	DI
 30833 0000559C 83C713                  	add	di,BUFINSIZ-1 ; 19
 30834                                  
 30835                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 30836 0000559F 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30837 000055A3 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 30838 000055A5 F8                      	CLC
 30839                                  POPP_RET:
 30840 000055A6 16                      	PUSH	SS
 30841 000055A7 1F                      	POP	DS
 30842 000055A8 59                      	POP	CX
 30843 000055A9 5B                      	POP	BX
 30844 000055AA 58                      	POP	AX
 30845 000055AB C3                      	retn
 30846                                  
 30847                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30848                                  
 30849                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 30850                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30851                                  ;
 30852                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 30853                                  ;
 30854                                  ; Inputs:
 30855                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 30856                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 30857                                  ; Function:
 30858                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 30859                                  ; Outputs:
 30860                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 30861                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 30862                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 30863                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 30864                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 30865                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 30866                                  ;
 30867                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30868                                  
 30869                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30870                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30871                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30872                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30873                                  
 30874                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 30875                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 30876 000055AC C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 30877                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 30878 000055B1 50                      	push	ax
 30879 000055B2 53                      	push	bx
 30880 000055B3 51                      	push	cx
 30881 000055B4 52                      	push	dx
 30882 000055B5 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 30883 000055B7 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 30884 000055BD 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 30885 000055BF D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 30886                                  Map16:	
 30887                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 30888 000055C1 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 30889                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30890 000055C3 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 30891 000055C5 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 30892 000055C7 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30893                                  
 30894                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30895                                  ;
 30896                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 30897                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 30898                                  ;
 30899                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 30900                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 30901                                  ;
 30902                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 30903                                  
 30904 000055CB 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 30905 000055CF 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 30906 000055D1 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 30907 000055D3 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 30908 000055D7 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 30909                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 30910                                  	;shr	al,1	
 30911                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 30912 000055D9 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 30913 000055DB D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 30914                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30915 000055DD 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 30916 000055DF EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 30917                                  _DoDiv:
 30918                                  ;ENDIF
 30919                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30920                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 30921                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30922 000055E1 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 30923                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 30924 000055E3 F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 30925                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30926                                  DivDone:
 30927                                  ;ENDIF
 30928                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 30929 000055E5 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 30930 000055E9 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 30931                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 30932 000055EA 50                      	push	ax
 30933 000055EB 52                      	push	dx
 30934 000055EC 51                      	push	cx
 30935 000055ED 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 30936                                  
 30937                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30938                                  	; 22/09/2023
 30939                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 30940                                  	;
 30941                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30942                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 30943                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 30944                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 30945                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 30946                                  	; 22/09/2023
 30947 000055EF E8CE02                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 30948                                  
 30949                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 30950 000055F2 59                      	pop	cx
 30951 000055F3 58                      	pop	ax
 30952 000055F4 5A                      	pop	dx
 30953 000055F5 724C                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30954                                  
 30955 000055F7 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30956                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 30957                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30958 000055FB 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30959 000055FE 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 30960 00005600 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 30961 00005602 752C                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 30962 00005604 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30963                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30964 00005606 16                      	push	ss
 30965 00005607 1F                      	pop	ds	
 30966 00005608 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 30967 0000560C A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 30968 0000560F 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 30969                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30970 00005613 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 30971 00005619 42                      	INC	DX
 30972                                  
 30973                                  	; 22/09/2023
 30974                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 30975                                  	;
 30976                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30977                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 30978                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 30979                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 30980                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 30981                                  	; 22/09/2023
 30982 0000561A E8A302                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 30983 0000561D 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30984                                  
 30985 0000561F C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]

 30988                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30989 00005628 16                      	push	ss
 30990 00005629 1F                      	pop	ds

 30992                                  
 30993                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 30994 0000562D BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 30995                                  MAPRET:
 30996                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 30997 00005630 5A                      	pop	dx
 30998 00005631 59                      	pop	cx
 30999 00005632 5B                      	pop	bx
 31000 00005633 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 31001 00005635 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?

 31003 0000563D 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 31004                                  MapSet:

 31006                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 31007 00005641 58                      	pop	ax
 31008 00005642 C3                      	retn
 31009                                  
 31010                                  MAP_POP:
 31011                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 31012 00005643 5A                      	pop	dx
 31013 00005644 59                      	pop	cx

 31016                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 31017 00005647 C3                      	retn

 31019                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31020                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31021                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31022                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31023                                  
 31024                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 31025                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31026                                  ;
 31027                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 31028                                  ;
 31029                                  ; Inputs:
 31030                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of intrest (local only,
 31031                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 31032                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 31033                                  ; Function:
 31034                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 31035                                  ;	if disk changed.
 31036                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 31037                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 31038                                  ; Outputs:
 31039                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31040                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 31041                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 31042                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 31043                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 31044                                  ;
 31045                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31046                                  
 31047                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 31048 00005648 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 31049                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31050                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 31051                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31052 0000564C 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 31053 00005650 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 31054 00005653 E8DCAF                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 31055                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 31056                                  	; 17/12/2022
 31057 00005656 EB78                    	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 31058                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 31059                                  	;retn
 31060                                  
 31061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31062                                  ;
 31063                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 31064                                  ;
 31065                                  ; Inputs:
 31066                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 31067                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of intrest (local only,
 31068                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 31069                                  ; Function:
 31070                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 31071                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 31072                                  ; Outputs:
 31073                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 31074                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 31075                                  ;	THISDRV set
 31076                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31077                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 31078                                  ;
 31079                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31080                                  
 31081                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31082                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31083                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31084                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31085                                  
 31086                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 31087 00005658 06                      	PUSH	ES
 31088 00005659 57                      	PUSH	DI
 31089                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 31090 0000565A 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 31091                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31092                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 31093                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31094 0000565E 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 31095 00005662 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 31096 00005665 E8CAAF                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 31097 00005668 E86500                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB

 31099 0000566C 07                      	POP	ES
 31100 0000566D 72D8                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 31101 0000566F 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 31102                                  
 31103                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 31104                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 31105                                  
 31106                                  MED_CHANGE:
 31107 00005671 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 31108 00005673 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 31109 00005674 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 31110 00005675 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 31111 00005679 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 31112                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 31113 0000567B 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 31114                                  
 31115                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31116                                  
 31117                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 31118                                  ;
 31119                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 31120                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 31121                                  
 31122 0000567F 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 31123                                  frcd20: 
 31124                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 31125                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 31126 00005684 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 31127 00005689 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 31128                                  
 31129                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31130                                  	;push	es
 31131                                  	;push	di
 31132                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 31133                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 31134                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 31135                                  	;pop	di
 31136                                  	;pop	es
 31137                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 31138                                  
 31139                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31140 0000568B 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 31141 0000568F 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 31142 00005691 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 31143 00005693 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 31144 00005697 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 31145                                  
 31146                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 31147                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 31148 00005699 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 31149 0000569D 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 31150                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 31151 0000569F 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 31152                                  frcd25:	
 31153                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 31154                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0

 31156 000056A6 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 31157 000056A8 1F                      	POP	DS

 31160 000056AD F8                      	CLC
 31161 000056AE C3                      	retn

 31175                                  FATERR:

 31233                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 31234 0000570E 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 31235 00005712 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 31236 00005714 C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1

 31238                                  					; new volume label.

 31247                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK

 31255

 31260                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0

 31271 00005737 1F                      	pop	ds

 31273 00005738 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY

 31293

 31301                                  nbuffer:

 31340                                  ; If no dirty buffers, assume Media changed
 31341                                  NEWDSK:

 31557                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 31558                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 31559                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 31560                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 31561                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 31562                                  ;; No other registers altered
 31563                                  ;
 31564                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 31565                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 31566                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 31567                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 31568                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 31569                                  ;SETLOOP:

 31573                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 31574                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 31575                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP

 31587                                  ;; Function:

 31595                                  ;       ;retz

 31597                                  ;

 31644                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 31645                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31646                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 31647                                  ; Inputs:
 31648                                  ;	 No Inputs
 31649                                  ; Function:
 31650                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 31651                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 31652                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 31653                                  ; Outputs:
 31654                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 31655                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 31656                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 31657                                  ; No other registers altered
 31658                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31659                                  
 31660                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31661                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31662                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31663                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31664                                  
 31665                                  GETCURHEAD:
 31666 0000585B 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 31667 00005860 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 31668 00005867 36893E[BB0E]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	;save first buffer addr
 31669 0000586C C3                      	retn

 31897                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 31898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31899                                  ;
 31900                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 31901                                  ; Inputs:
 31902                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 31903                                  ; Function:
 31904                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 31905                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 31906                                  ;	   same segment
 31907                                  ;
 31908                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 31909                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 31910                                  ; No Registers altered
 31911                                  ;
 31912                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31913

 31930                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31931                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 31932                                  
 31933                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 31934                                  
 31935                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31937                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 31938                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31939                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 31940                                  ; 
 31941                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31942                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31943                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 31944                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31945                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31946                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31947                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31948                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31949                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31950                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31951                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31953                                  
 31954                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31955                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31956                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 31957                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31958                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 31959                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 31960                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 31961                                  ; 
 31962                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31963                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31964                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 31965                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 31966                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31967                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31968                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31969                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31970                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31971                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31972                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31973                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31975

 32319                                  ;Break	<FLUSHBUF -- WRITE OUT DIRTY BUFFERS>
 32320                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32321                                  ; Input:
 32322                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 32323                                  ;	AL = Physical unit number local buffers only
 32324                                  ;	   = -1 for all units and all remote buffers
 32325                                  ; Function:
 32326                                  ;	Write out all dirty buffers for unit, and flag them as clean
 32327                                  ;	Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 32328                                  ;	    Flush operation completed.

 32330                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32332                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 32417                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32418                                  ;
 32419                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 32420                                  ;
 32421                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 32422                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 32423                                  ;
 32424                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 32425                                  ;
 32426                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32427                                  ;
 32428                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32429                                  
 32430                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 32431                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32432 00005A10 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1 ; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 32433                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 32434 00005A12 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 32435 00005A15 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 32436 00005A17 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 32437 00005A19 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 32438                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 32439 00005A1B 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 32440 00005A1E F8                      	CLC
 32441 00005A1F 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 32442                                  DOBUFFER:
 32443                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 32444 00005A21 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 32445 00005A25 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 32446 00005A27 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32447                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 32448 00005A28 FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 32449 00005A2B E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 32450 00005A2E 58                      	POP	AX
 32451 00005A2F 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 32452                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 32453 00005A31 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 32454                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 32455 00005A34 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 32456                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 32457 00005A37 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 32458                                  checkflush_retn:
 32459 00005A38 C3                      	retn

 32607                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 32608                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32609                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 32610                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &

 32680                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 32681                                  ;============================================================================
 32682                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32683                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32684                                  
 32685                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 32686                                  
 32687                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 32688                                  
 32689                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 32690                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 32691                                  
 32692                                  ; =========================================================================
 32693                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 32694                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 32695                                  ;
 32696                                  ;	$WAIT
 32697                                  ;	$EXEC
 32698                                  ;	$Keep_process
 32699                                  ;	Stay_resident
 32700                                  ;	$EXIT
 32701                                  ;	$ABORT
 32702                                  ;	abort_inner
 32703                                  ;
 32704                                  ;	Modification history:
 32705                                  ;
 32706                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 32707                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 32708                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 32709                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 32710                                  ;
 32711                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 32712                                  ;
 32713                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 32714                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 32715                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 32716                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 32717                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 32718                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 32719                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 32720                                  ;
 32721                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 32722                                  ;
 32723                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 32724                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 32725                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 32726                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 32727                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 32728                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 32729                                  ;
 32730                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 32731                                  ;
 32732                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 32733                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 32734                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 32735                                  ;
 32736                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 32737                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 32738                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 32739                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 32740                                  ;
 32741                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 32742                                  ;
 32743                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 32744                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 32745                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 32746                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 32747                                  ;
 32748                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 32749                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 32750                                  ;		       UMBs.
 32751                                  ;
 32752                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 32753                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 32754                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 32755                                  ;
 32756                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 32757                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 32758                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 32759                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 32760                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 32761                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 32762                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 32763                                  ;
 32764                                  ; =========================================================================
 32765                                  
 32766                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 32767                                  
 32768                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 32769                                  ; =========================================================================
 32770                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 32771                                  ;
 32772                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 32773                                  ;
 32774                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 32775                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 32776                                  ;
 32777                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 32778                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 32779                                  ;	USES	all
 32780                                  ; =========================================================================
 32781                                  
 32782                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32783                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32784                                  
 32785                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32786                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 32787                                  _$WAIT:
 32788                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32789                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 32790                                  
 32791 00005AEA 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 32792 00005AEC 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 32793 00005AF1 E947AB                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 32794                                  
 32795                                  ; =========================================================================
 32796                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 32797                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 32798                                  ;
 32799                                  ;
 32800                                  ; Assembler usage:
 32801                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 32802                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 32803                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 32804                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 32805                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 32806                                  ;
 32807                                  ;	AL  Function
 32808                                  ;	--  --------
 32809                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 32810                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 32811                                  ;	    begin execution.
 32812                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 32813                                  ;
 32814                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 32815                                  ;
 32816                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32817                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32818                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32819                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32820                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32821                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32822                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32823                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32824                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32825                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32826                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32827                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32828                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32829                                  ;
 32830                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 32831                                  ;
 32832                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32833                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32834                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32835                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32836                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32837                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32838                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32839                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32840                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32841                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32842                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32843                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32844                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32845                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32846                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 32847                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32848                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32849                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 32850                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32851                                  ;
 32852                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 32853                                  ;
 32854                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32855                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 32856                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 32857                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32858                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 32859                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 32860                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32861                                  ;
 32862                                  ; Returns:
 32863                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 32864                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 32865                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 32866                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 32867                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found

 32924                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 32926                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 32927                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]
