 36099                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 36100                                  
 36101                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 36102                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36103                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 36104                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 36105                                  ;
 36106                                  ;	NOTE:
 36107                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 36108                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 36109                                  ;
 36110                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 36111                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 36112                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 36113                                  ;		'C' set if error
 36114                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 36115                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 36116                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36117                                  
 36118                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36119                                  
 36120                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 36121                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36122                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 36123 000065DA 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36124                                  	
 36125                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 36126 000065DF 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 36127                                  
 36128                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 36129 000065E4 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 36130 000065E9 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 36131                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36132                                  	;mov	al,6
 36133 000065EB B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 36134                                  ReturnCarry:
 36135 000065ED F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 36136 000065EE C3                      	retn				; go back
 36137                                  pjfn10: 
 36138                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 36139 000065EF 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 36140 000065F4 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 36141                                  	;clc
 36142                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 36143 000065F6 C3                      	retn
 36144                                  
 36145                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 36146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36147                                  ;
 36148                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 36149                                  ;
 36150                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 36151                                  ;
 36152                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 36153                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 36154                                  ;                   AX has error code
 36155                                  ;               Carry Reset
 36156                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 36157                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 36158                                  ; NOTE:
 36159                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 36160                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 36161                                  ;
 36162                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36163                                  
 36164                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36165                                  
 36166                                  SFFromHandle:
 36167 000065F7 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 36168                                  	;retc				; return if error
 36169 000065FA 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 36170 000065FC 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 36171                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 36172                                  	;;mov	al,6
 36173                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 36174                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 36175                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36176                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36177 00006600 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 36178                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 36179                                  	;;mov	al,6
 36180                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 36181                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 36182                                  GetSF:
 36183 00006602 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 36184 00006603 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 36185 00006606 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 36186 00006608 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 36187 0000660B 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 36188 0000660C C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 36189                                  
 36190                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 36191                                  
 36192                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 36193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36194                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 36195                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 36196                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 36197                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 36198                                  ;
 36199                                  ;   NOTE:
 36200                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 36201                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 36202                                  ;
 36203                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 36204                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 36205                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 36206                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 36207                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 36208                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36209                                  
 36210                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36211                                  
 36212                                  SFFromSFN:
 36213                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36214                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 36215 0000660D 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36216                                  
 36217                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 36218 00006612 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 36219                                  sfsfn5:	
 36220                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 36221 00006617 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 36222 0000661B 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 36223                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 36224 0000661D 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 36225 00006621 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 36226                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 36227 00006624 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 36228 00006627 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 36229 00006629 F9                      	STC
 36230 0000662A C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 36231                                  sfsfn7:
 36232 0000662B 50                      	push	ax
 36233                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 36234                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 36235                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 36236                                  	
 36237                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36238 0000662C B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 36239                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36240                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 36241                                  	
 36242 0000662E F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 36243 00006630 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 36244 00006632 58                      	pop	ax
 36245                                  	;add	di,6
 36246 00006633 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 36247 00006636 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 36248                                  
 36249                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 36250                                  
 36251                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 36252                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36253                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 36254                                  ;
 36255                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 36256                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 36257                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 36258                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 36259                                  ;		'C' set if error
 36260                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 36261                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 36262                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36263                                  
 36264                                  JFNFree:
 36265 00006637 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 36266                                  jfnf1:	
 36267 00006639 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 36268 0000663C 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 36269 0000663E 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 36270 00006642 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 36271 00006644 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 36272 00006645 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 36273                                  
 36274                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 36275                                  jfnf5:	
 36276                                  	;mov	al,4
 36277 00006647 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 36278                                  jfnfx:	
 36279 00006649 C3                      	retn				; bye
 36280                                  
 36281                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 36282                                  
 36283                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 36284                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36285                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 36286                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 36287                                  ;
 36288                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 36289                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 36290                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 36291                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 36292                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 36293                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 36294                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 36295                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 36296                                  ;
 36297                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 36298                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 36299                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 36300                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 36301                                  ;
 36302                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 36303                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 36304                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 36305                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 36306                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 36307                                  ;		'C' set if error
 36308                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 36309                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 36310                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36311                                  
 36312                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36313                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36314                                  
 36315                                  SFNFree:
 36316                                  	; 12/08/2018
 36317                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36318                                  	;
 36319                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36320 0000664A 50                      	push	ax
 36321 0000664B 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 36322                                  sfnf5:	
 36323 0000664D 53                      	push	bx
 36324 0000664E E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 36325 00006651 5B                      	pop	bx
 36326 00006652 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 36327 00006654 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 36328                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 36329 00006658 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 36330                                  	
 36331                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 36332 0000665A 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 36333                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 36334 0000665E 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 36335                                  sfnf7:	
 36336 00006660 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 36337 00006661 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 36338                                  
 36339                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 36340                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 36341                                  ;
 36342                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 36343                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 36344                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 36345                                  
 36346                                  sfnf10:	
 36347 00006663 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 36348                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 36349 00006667 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 36350 0000666B 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 36351 0000666D 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 36352                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 36353 00006671 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 36354 00006675 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 36355                                  
 36356                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 36357                                  ;
 36358                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 36359                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 36360                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 36361                                  
 36362                                  sfnf20:
 36363                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 36364                                  
 36365                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 36366 00006677 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 36367                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 36368                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 36369                                  
 36370 0000667C 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 36371                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 36372 00006680 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 36373 00006684 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 36374                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 36375 00006688 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 36376                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 36377                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36378                                  	;pop	ax
 36379                                  	;;clc
 36380                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 36381                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36382 0000668C 58                      	pop	ax
 36383                                  	;clc
 36384 0000668D C3                      	retn
 36385

 36405                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 36406                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36407                                  ;
 36408                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 36409                                  ;
 36410                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 36411                                  ;		path
 36412                                  ;
 36413                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 36414                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 36415                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 36416                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 36417                                  ;
 36418                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 36419                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 36420                                  ;	USES	all
 36421                                  ;
 36422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36423                                  
 36424                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36425                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36426                                  
 36427                                  _$CLOSE:
 36428                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 36429                                  
 36430 00006692 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 36431 00006695 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 36432 00006697 16                      	push	ss
 36433 00006698 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 36434 00006699 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 36435 0000669D 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 36436                                  
 36437                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 36438                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 36439                                  ;
 36440                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 36441                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 36442                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 36443                                  
 36444                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 36445 000066A1 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 36446 000066A5 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 36447                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 36448 000066A7 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 36449                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 36450 000066AB 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 36451                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 36452 000066AD 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 36453 000066AF 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 36454                                  
 36455                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 36456                                  ; -1.
 36457                                  
 36458                                  FreeJFN:
 36459 000066B1 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 36460 000066B4 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 36461                                  PostFree:
 36462                                  
 36463                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 36464                                  
 36465 000066B8 E80FC8                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 36466                                  
 36467                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 36468                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 36469                                  
 36470 000066BB 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 36471                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 36472 000066BD B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 36473                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36474                                  CloseOk:
 36475 000066BF E9799F                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 36476                                  CloseError:
 36477 000066C2 E97F9F                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 36478                                  
 36479                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 36480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36481                                  ;
 36482                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 36483                                  ;
 36484                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 36485                                  ;	flushed out.  BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 36486                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check

 36529                                  ;	BREAK <$ExtHandle - extend handle count>

 36532                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 36570                                  chck_handles:

 37157                                  ;BREAK <$DUP - duplicate a jfn>
 37158                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37159                                  ;
 37160                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 37161                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 37162                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup
 37163                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 37164                                  ;	  AX has the returned handle
 37165                                  ;   Errors:
 37166                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle
 37167                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files
 37168                                  ;
 37169                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37170                                  
 37171                                  _$DUP:
 37172 000068C3 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; save away old handle in AX
 37173 000068C5 E86FFD                  	call	JFNFree 		; free handle? into ES:DI, new in BX
 37174                                  DupErrorCheck:
 37175 000068C8 72A8                    	JC	short DupErr		; nope, bye
 37176 000068CA 06                      	push	es
 37177 000068CB 57                      	push	di			; save away SFT
 37178 000068CC 5E                      	pop	si			; into convenient place DS:SI
 37179 000068CD 1F                      	pop	ds
 37180 000068CE 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX			; get back old handle
 37181 000068CF E81D00                  	call	CheckOwner		; get sft in ES:DI
 37182 000068D2 729E                    	JC	short DupErr		; errors go home
 37183 000068D4 E80BC1                  	call	DOS_Dup_Direct
 37184 000068D7 E800FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 37185 000068DA 268A1D                  	MOV	BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFT number
 37186 000068DD 881C                    	MOV	[SI],BL			; stuff in new SFT
 37187                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37188                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; and go home
 37189 000068DF EBD5                    	jmp	short ok_ret
 37190                                  
 37191                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37192                                  ;DupErr:
 37193                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37194                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 37195                                  	;jmp	short ft_error
 37196                                  
 37197                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 37198                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37199                                  ;
 37200                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 37201                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 37202                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 37203                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 37204                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 37205                                  ;   Error returns:
 37206                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 37207                                  ;
 37208                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37209                                  
 37210                                  _$DUP2:
 37211 000068E1 53                      	push	bx
 37212 000068E2 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 37213 000068E3 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 37214 000068E5 E8AAFD                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 37215 000068E8 5B                      	pop	bx
 37216 000068E9 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 37217 000068EA E8EDFC                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 37218 000068ED EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup
 37219                                  
 37220                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 37221                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37222                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 37223                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 37224                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 37225                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 37226                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 37227                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 37228                                  ;
 37229                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 37230                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 37231                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 37232                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 37233                                  ;	USES	none
 37234                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37235                                  
 37236                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37237                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37238                                  CheckOwner:
 37239                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37240                                  
 37241 000068EF E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 37242 000068F2 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 37243                                  
 37244 000068F4 50                      	push	ax
 37245                                  
 37246                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37247                                  
 37248                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 37249                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 37250

 37252 000068FB 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 37253 000068FD 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 37254 000068FF EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 37255                                  
 37256                                  no_win386:
 37257 00006901 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]		;smr;SS Override
 37258                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 37259 00006905 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 37260                                  
 37261                                  _skip_win386:
 37262 00006909 58                      	pop	ax
 37263                                  	
 37264                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37265 0000690A 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label
 37266                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37267                                  	;jnz	short CheckOwner_err
 37268                                  	;retn

 37281                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 37282                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37283                                  
 37284                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 37285                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 37286                                  
 37287                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 37288                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 37289                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 37290                                  
 37291                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 37292                                  ;
 37293                                  ;	$AssignOper
 37294                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 37295                                  ;	InitCDS
 37296                                  ;	$UserOper
 37297                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 37298                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 37299                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 37300                                  ;
 37301                                  ;   Revision history:
 37302                                  ;
 37303                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 37304                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 37305                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 37306                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 37307                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 37308                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 37309                                  ;				    aliasing.
 37310                                  ;
 37311                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 37312                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 37313                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 37314                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 37315                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 37316                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 37317                                  ;
 37318                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 37319                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 37320                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 37321                                  ;
 37322                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 37323                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 37324                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 37325                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 37326                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 37327                                  ;
 37328                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 37329                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 37330                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 37331                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 37332                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 37333                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 37334                                  ;
 37335                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 37336                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 37337                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 37338                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 37339                                  ;   number.
 37340                                  ;
 37341                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 37342                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 37343                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 37344                                  ;   TransPath.
 37345                                  ;
 37346                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37347                                  
 37348                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 37349                                  
 37350                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 37351                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 37352                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 37353                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 37354                                  ;					; current drive)
 37355                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 37356                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 37357                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 37358                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 37359                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 37360                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 37361                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 37362                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 37363                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 37364                                  
 37365                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 37366                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37367                                  ; Inputs:
 37368                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 37369                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 37370                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 37371                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 37372                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 37373                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 37374                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 37375                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 37376                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 37377                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 37378                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 37379                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 37380                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 37381                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 37382                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 37383                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 37384                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 37385                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 37386                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 37387                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 37388                                  ; Function:
 37389                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 37390                                  ; Returns:
 37391                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 37392                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37393                                  
 37394                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37395                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37396                                  _$AssignOper:
 37397                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37398 00006910 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set in_use ?		;AN000;
 37399 00006912 7525                    	JNZ	short chk08		      ; no			;AN000;
 37400                                  srinuse:								;AN000;

 37402 00006915 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL			      ; AL= drive id		;AN000;
 37403 00006917 E85601                  	CALL	GetCDSFromDrv		      ; ds:si -> cds		;AN000;
 37404 0000691A 58                      	POP	AX			      ; 			;AN000;
 37405 0000691B 7216                    	JC	short baddrv		      ; bad drive		;AN000;
 37406                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0
 37407 0000691D 837C4500                	CMP	WORD [SI+curdir.devptr],0     ; dpb ptr =0 ?		;AN000;
 37408 00006921 7410                    	JZ	short baddrv		      ;     no			;AN000;
 37409 00006923 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set ?			;AN000;
 37410 00006925 7506                    	JNZ	short resetdrv		      ; no			;AN000;

 37414 00006927 804C4440                	or	byte [SI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_inuse>>8)
 37415                                  	;OR	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_inuse ; set in_use	;AN000;
 37416 0000692B EB19                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;
 37417                                  resetdrv:
 37418                                  	;and	word [si+43h],0BFFFh									;AN000;
 37419                                  	; 18/12/2022

 37422 00006931 EB13                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;

 37425                                  baddrv: 								;AN000;
 37426 00006933 B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_invalid_drive	      ; error			;AN000;

 37428                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37429                                  	;JMP	SHORT ASS_ERR		      ; 			;AN000;
 37430                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37431                                  	; 21/05/2019
 37432                                  ASS_ERR:

 37440                                  	;transfer NET_ASSOPER
 37441                                    ;ELSE
 37442                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 37448                                  			; SS = DOS CS

 37464                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 37465                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37466                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 37467                                  ;
 37468                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 37469                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 37470                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 37471                                  ;		'C' clear
 37472                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 37473                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags

 37477                                  FIND_DPB:

 37486                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37487 00006957 C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 37488 0000695A EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5

 37494                                  ;	Break <InitCDS - set up an empty CDS>
 37495                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37496                                  ;**	InitCDS - Setup an Empty CDS
 37497                                  ;

 37499                                  ;		AL has uppercase drive letter
 37500                                  ;	EXIT	ThisCDS is now empty
 37501                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS
 37502                                  ;		'C' set if no DPB associated with drive
 37503                                  ;	USES	AH,ES,DI, Flags
 37504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37505                                  
 37506                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 37561                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 37562                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37563                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 37564                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 37565                                  ;
 37566                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 37567                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 37568                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 37569                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 37570                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 37571                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 37572                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 37573                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 37574                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 37575                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 37576                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 37577                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37578

 37837                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 37838                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37839                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 37840                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 37841                                  ;
 37842                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 37843                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 37844                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 37845                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 37846                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 37847                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 37848                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37849                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37850                                  
 37851                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37852                                  TransFCB:
 37853                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37854                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37855                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 37856                                  	;ENTER
 37857 00006A90 55                      	push	bp
 37858 00006A91 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 37859                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 37860 00006A93 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 37861 00006A96 16                      	push	ss
 37862 00006A97 07                      	pop	es
 37863 00006A98 06                      	push	es
 37864 00006A99 57                      	push	di
 37865                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37866                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 37867 00006A9A 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 37868 00006A9D 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 37869 00006AA3 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37870 00006AA9 E8AAB1                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 37871                                  	; 06/12/2022
 37872 00006AAC 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 37873 00006AAE 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 37874 00006AB1 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37875 00006AB5 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 37876                                  GetDrive:
 37877 00006ABB AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 37878 00006ABC E85CFF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 37879 00006ABF 722A                    	jc	short BadPack

 37881

 37883

 37906 00006AD9 07                      	pop	es

 37908 00006ADB 1F                      	pop	ds
 37909                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37910                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 37911 00006ADC 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]

 37916 00006AE8 5D                      	pop	bp

 37918                                  BadPack:

 37931                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 37932                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37933                                  ;
 37934                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 37935                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 37936                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 37937                                  ;       exactly.
 37938                                  ;
 37939                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 37940                                  ;       matches splice.
 37941                                  ;
 37942                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 37943                                  ;
 37944                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 37945                                  ;
 37946                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 37947                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 37948                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 37949                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 37950                                  ;
 37951                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 37952                                  ;
 37953                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 37954                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 37955                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 37956                                  ;
 37957                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 37958                                  ;
 37959                                  ;       if fSharing then
 37960                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37961                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37962                                  ;           splice
 37963                                  ;           fatRead
 37964                                  ;           return
 37965                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 37966                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 37967                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37968                                  ;           return
 37969                                  ;       if device then
 37970                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37971                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37972                                  ;           return
 37973                                  ;       if file then
 37974                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 37975                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 37976                                  ;           Copy current dir
 37977                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 37978                                  ;           splice
 37979                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 37980                                  ;           if local then
 37981                                  ;               fatread
 37982                                  ;           return
 37983                                  ;
 37984                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37985                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 37986                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37987                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 37988                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 37989                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 37990                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 37991                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37992                                  ;
 37993                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37994                                  
 37995                                  ; 22/05/2019
 37996                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37997                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37998                                  
 37999                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38000                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38001                                  
 38002                                  TransPath:
 38003 00006AF2 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 38004 00006AF4 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 38005                                  TransPathSet:
 38006 00006AF6 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 38007                                  SetSplice:
 38008 00006AF8 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 38009 00006AFC B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 38010                                  TransPathNoSet:

 38021                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.

 38034 00006B33 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 38035                                  ;
 38036                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 38037                                  ;
 38038 00006B35 16                      	push	ss
 38039 00006B36 1F                      	pop	ds

 38044                                  NoServerSplice:

 38056                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 38057                                  ; the name if so.

 38064                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 38065                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name

 38109                                  
 38110                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 38111

 38123                                  
 38124                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38125                                  %if 0
 38126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38127                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 38128                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 38129                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 38130                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 38131                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 38132                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 38133                                  ;;;
 38134                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 38135                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 38136                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 38137                                  ;;;
 38138                                  ;;;More info:
 38139                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 38140                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 38141                                  ;;;
 38142                                  	call	no5Dshere
 38143                                  start5Dhack:
 38144                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice         
 38145                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 38146                                  
 38147                                  %endif
 38148                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38149                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 38150 00006BA0 E8FED6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 38151                                  
 38152 00006BA3 5D                      	pop	bp
 38153 00006BA4 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 38154 00006BA5 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 38155                                  
 38156                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 38157                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 38158                                  ; call.
 38159                                  
 38160 00006BA7 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 38161 00006BAD E86BFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 38162 00006BB0 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 38163                                  
 38164                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 38165                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 38166                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 38167                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 38168                                  ; a device.

 38178                                  DoFile_retn:

 38187                                  %endif

 38190

 38200                                  
 38201                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 38202                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 38203                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 38204                                  
 38205                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.

 38209 00006BCD 57                      	push	di
 38210 00006BCE E814D6                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 38211                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 38212 00006BD1 5F                      	pop	di
