 38214 00006BD3 5E                      	pop	si
 38215 00006BD4 1F                      	pop	ds
 38216                                  	;mov	al,3
 38217 00006BD5 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 38218                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 38219 00006BD7 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 38220                                  
 38221                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 38222                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 38223                                  
 38224 00006BD9 1E                      	push	ds
 38225 00006BDA 56                      	push	si
 38226 00006BDB 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 38227 00006BE0 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 38228                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 38229 00006BE2 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 38230                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 38231 00006BE5 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 38232                                  					;AN000;
 38233 00006BE9 E8FBA5                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 38234 00006BEC 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 38235                                  
 38236                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 38237                                  
 38238 00006BED B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 38239 00006BEF 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 38240 00006BF3 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 38241 00006BF5 AA                      	STOSB
 38242                                  
 38243                                  ; Now get original string.
 38244                                  
 38245                                  GetOrig:
 38246 00006BF6 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 38247 00006BF7 5E                      	pop	si
 38248 00006BF8 1F                      	pop	ds
 38249                                  
 38250                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 38251                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 38252                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 38254 00006BF9 E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 38255 00006BFC 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 38256 00006BFE 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 38257 00006C00 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 38258                                  ;
 38259                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 38260                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 38261                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 38262                                  ;
 38263 00006C02 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 38264                                  SkipPath:
 38265 00006C04 AC                      	LODSB
 38266 00006C05 E817E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 38267 00006C08 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 38268 00006C0A 4E                      	DEC     SI
 38269 00006C0B 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 38270 00006C0D 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 38271                                  
 38272                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 38273                                  ; for yucks.
 38274                                  
 38275                                  PathAssure:
 38276 00006C0F B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 38277 00006C11 AA                      	STOSB
 38278                                  
 38279                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 38280                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 38281                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 38282                                  
 38283                                  DoCanon:
 38284 00006C12 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 38285                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 38286 00006C15 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 38287                                  
 38288                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 38289                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 38290                                  ; buffer.
 38291                                  
 38292 00006C17 16                      	push	ss
 38293 00006C18 1F                      	pop	ds
 38294 00006C19 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 38295 00006C1D C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 38296 00006C21 E81B02                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 38297 00006C24 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 38298                                  
 38299                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 38300                                  
 38301 00006C26 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 38302 00006C29 E8F3E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 38303 00006C2C 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 38304                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 38305 00006C2E 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 38306 00006C32 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 38307 00006C34 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 38308 00006C35 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 38309                                  
 38310                                  ; Splice the result.
 38311                                  
 38312                                  DoSplice:
 38313 00006C3A 16                      	push	ss
 38314 00006C3B 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 38315 00006C3C 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 38316 00006C40 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 38317 00006C42 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 38318 00006C47 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 38319 00006C49 E82A01                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 38320                                  SkipSplice:
 38321                                  
 38322                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 38323                                  ; device.
 38324                                  
 38325 00006C4C 16                      	push	ss
 38326 00006C4D 1F                      	pop	ds
 38327 00006C4E C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 38328                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 38329                                  	; 17/12/2022
 38330                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 38331 00006C52 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 38332                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 38333 00006C57 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 38334 00006C59 E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 38335 00006C5B E8B4A6                  	call	ECritDisk
 38336 00006C5E E8F7E9                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 38337 00006C61 E8C9A6                  	call	LCritDisk
 38338                                  	;mov	al, 3
 38339 00006C64 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 38340                                  Done:   
 38341 00006C66 C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 38342                                  
 38343                                  ; 13/07/2018
 38344                                  
 38345                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 38346                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38347                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 38348                                  ;
 38349                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 38350                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 38351                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 38352                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 38353                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 38354                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 38355                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 38356                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 38357                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 38358                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 38359                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38360                                  
 38361                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38362                                  
 38363                                  Canonicalize:
 38364                                  
 38365                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 38366                                  
 38367 00006C67 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 38368 00006C68 E8B4E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 38369 00006C6B 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 38370 00006C6D 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 38371 00006C6F 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 38372 00006C71 AA                      	STOSB
 38373 00006C72 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 38374                                  CanonDec:
 38375 00006C74 4E                      	DEC     SI
 38376                                  
 38377                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 38378                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 38379                                  ; buffer.
 38380                                  
 38381                                  CanonLoop:
 38382                                  
 38383                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 38384                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 38385                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 38386                                  
 38387 00006C75 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 38388 00006C77 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 38389 00006C79 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 38390 00006C7B 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 38391 00006C80 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 38392 00006C82 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 38393 00006C84 AA                      	STOSB
 38394 00006C85 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 38395                                  DoTerminate:
 38396 00006C87 AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 38397 00006C88 F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 38398 00006C89 C3                      	retn
 38399                                  
 38400                                  CanonBad:
 38401 00006C8A E8CB01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 38402                                  	;mov	al,3
 38403 00006C8D B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 38404 00006C8F 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 38405                                  	;mov	al,2
 38406 00006C91 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 38407                                  PathEnc:
 38408 00006C93 F9                      	STC
 38409                                  CanonBad_retn:
 38410 00006C94 C3                      	retn
 38411                                  
 38412                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 38413                                  ; it to 8.3
 38414                                  
 38415                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 38416 00006C95 E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 38417 00006C98 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 38418                                  
 38419                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases.  These will be backed up.
 38420                                  
 38421                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 38422 00006C9A 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 38423 00006C9E 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1
 38424                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'..'
 38425 00006CA0 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 38426 00006CA5 750A                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 38427 00006CA7 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 38428                                  Skip1:  
 38429 00006CA8 E82A00                  	CALL    SkipBack                ;           SkipBack ();
 38430                                  	;mov	al,3
 38431 00006CAB B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 38432 00006CAD 72E5                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn
 38433 00006CAF EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 38434                                  
 38435                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 38436                                  
 38437                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 38438 00006CB1 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 38439                                  
 38440                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 38441                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 38442                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 38443                                  
 38444                                  CanonPath:
 38445 00006CB3 E81600                  	CALL    PathSep
 38446 00006CB6 75D2                    	JNZ	short CanonBad		; something else...
 38447                                  
 38448                                  ; Copy the first path char we see.
 38449                                  
 38450 00006CB8 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get the char
 38451 00006CB9 E863E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it path char?

 38630                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 38631                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38632                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 38633                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 38634                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 38635                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 38636                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 38637                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 38638                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 38639                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.

 38643                                  ;                   left alone

 38668 00006D9B 57                      	push	di
 38669 00006D9C E8A000                  	CALL    PathPref                ;           if (!PathPref (s, d))
 38670 00006D9F 7403                    	JZ	short SpliceFound	;

 38722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38723                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 38724                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 38725                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 38726                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 38727                                  ;

 38729                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer

 38752                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 38753                                  ; and restore CX.
 38754

 38828                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 38829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38830                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 38831                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 38832                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 38833                                  ;
 38834                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 38835                                  ;               ES:DI string
 38836                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 38837                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 38838                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 38839                                  ;   Registers modified: CX

 38846 00006E45 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 38847 00006E47 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 38848 00006E48 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 38849 00006E4B E8D1E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 38850 00006E4E 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 38851                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 38853 00006E53 E878FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 38854                                  Prefix:
 38855 00006E56 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 38856 00006E57 C3                      	retn

 38894                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 38895                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 38896                                  ;           INT     int_command
 38897                                  ;
 38898                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 38899                                  ;       ------          --------
 38900                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 38901                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 38902                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 38903                                  ;
 38904                                  ;   Error returns:
 38905                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 38906                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 38907                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 38908                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 38909                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38910                                  
 38911                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38912                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 38913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38914                                  ;
 38915                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 38916                                  ;
 38917                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 38918                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 38919                                  ;
 38920                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 38921                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 38922                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 38923                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 38924                                  ;		'C' set if error
 38925                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 38926                                  ;	USES	all
 38927                                  ;
 38928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38929                                  
 38930                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38931                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38932                                  
 38933                                  _$OPEN:       
 38934 00006E61 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 38935                                  _$Open2:
 38936                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 38937 00006E63 B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 38938 00006E65 E85702                  	call	SetAttrib
 38939 00006E68 B9[142B]                	mov	cx,DOS_OPEN
 38940                                  
 38941                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38942                                  
 38943 00006E6B 50                      	push	ax
 38944                                  
 38945                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 38946                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 38947                                  ;
 38948                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 38949                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 38950                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 38951                                  ;
 38952                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 38953                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 38954                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 38955                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 38956                                  
 38957                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 38958                                  
 38959                                  AccessFile:
 38960 00006E6C E8A3A4                  	call	ECritSFT
 38961 00006E6F E8D8F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 38962 00006E72 E8B8A4                  	call	LCritSFT

 38964 00006E77 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 38965 00006E7C 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 38966 00006E81 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 38967                                  
 38968                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 38969                                  
 38970 00006E86 E8AEF7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 38971 00006E89 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 38972                                  OpenFailJ:
 38973 00006E8B E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 38974                                  
 38975                                  SaveJFN:
 38976 00006E8E 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 38977 00006E93 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 38978 00006E98 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 38979                                  
 38980                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 38981                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 38982                                  
 38983 00006E9D 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 38984 00006EA2 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 38985 00006EA5 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place

 38990                                  
 38991 00006EAF 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 38992 00006EB4 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 38993 00006EB6 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 38994 00006EBC 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch

 38999                                  
 39000                                  SetSearch:

 39002                                  
 39003                                  ;	We need to get the new inheritance bits.
 39004                                  
 39005 00006EC3 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx

 39027                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 39030                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 39031                                  
 39032                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39033                                  	;SAVE	<di, es>                ;M022 conditional removed here

 39035 00006EDB 06                      	push	es
 39036 00006EDC 1E                      	push	ds

 39042 00006EE3 07                      	pop	es

 39407                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 39408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39409                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry.  Return a file handle if there
 39410                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 39411                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 39412                                  ;
 39413                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 39414                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 39415                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 39416                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 39417                                  ;		Carry Set:
 39418                                  ;		    AX has error code
 39419                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 39420                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39421                                  
 39422                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 39423 00007021 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 39424 00007022 B9[B72A]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 39425 00007025 E914FF                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 39426                                  
 39427                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 39428                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39429                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 39430                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 39431                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 39432                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 39433                                  ;
 39434                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 39435                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 39436                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 39437                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 39438                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39439                                  
 39440                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 39441                                  ;BinToAscii:
 39442                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 39443                                  ;bta5:
 39444                                  ;	push    cx
 39445                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 39446                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 39447                                  ;	push    ax
 39448                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 39449                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 39450                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 39451                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 39452                                  ;	add     al,7
 39453                                  ;bta6: 
 39454                                  ;	stosb
 39455                                  ;	pop     ax
 39456                                  ;	pop     cx
 39457                                  ;	loop    bta5
 39458                                  ;	retn
 39459                                  
 39460                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39461                                  BinToAscii:
 39462 00007028 B90404                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 39463                                  bta5:	
 39464 0000702B D3C0                    	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 39465 0000702D 50                      	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 39466 0000702E 240F                    	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 39467 00007030 0441                    	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 39468 00007032 AA                      	STOSB				; drop in the character
 39469 00007033 58                      	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 39470 00007034 FECD                    	dec	ch
 39471 00007036 75F3                    	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 39472 00007038 C3                      	retn
 39473                                  
 39474                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 39475                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39476                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 39477                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 39478                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 39479                                  ;
 39480                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 39481                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 39482                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 39483                                  ;		AX has handle
 39484                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 39485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39486                                  
 39487                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39488                                  
 39489                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 39490                                  	;Enter
 39491 00007039 55                      	push	bp
 39492 0000703A 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39493                                  
 39494                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 39495                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 39496                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 39497                                  
 39498 0000703C 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 39499                                  
 39500                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 39501 0000703F F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 39502 00007043 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 39503                                  
 39504                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 39505                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 39506                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 39507                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 39508                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 39509                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 39510                                  
 39511                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 39512 00007045 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 39513 00007048 EB69                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 39514                                  
 39515                                  OKatts:
 39516                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 39517 0000704A 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 39518                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 39519 0000704D 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 39520                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 39521 00007050 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 39522                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 39523 00007053 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 39524 00007056 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 39525 00007057 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 39526 00007058 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 39527 0000705A 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 39528 0000705C F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 39529                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39530 0000705E 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 39531 00007060 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 39532                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 39533                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39534                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39535 00007062 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 39536                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 39537                                  okok:					;AN000;
 39538 00007063 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 39539 00007065 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 39540                                  					;AN000;
 39541 00007067 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 39542 00007068 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 39543 0000706C E8B0DF                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 39544 0000706F 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 39545                                  STOREPTH:
 39546 00007071 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 39547 00007073 AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 39548                                  SETENDPTR:
 39549                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 39550 00007074 8856FC                  	mov	[bp-4],dl
 39551                                  CreateLoop:

 39553 00007078 1F                      	pop	ds
 39554 00007079 55                      	push	bp
 39555 0000707A E8A29A                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 39556 0000707D 5D                      	pop	bp
 39557                                  ;
 39558                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 39559                                  ;
 39560                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 39561 0000707E C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 39562 00007081 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 39563 00007083 E8A2FF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store upper word
 39564 00007086 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 39565 00007088 E89DFF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store lower word
 39566 0000708B 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 39567 0000708D AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 39568                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name
 39569 0000708E C556F8                  	lds	dx,[bp-8]

 39572 00007094 55                      	push	bp
 39573 00007095 E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 39574 00007098 5D                      	pop	bp
 39575 00007099 7319                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 39576                                  
 39577                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 39578                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 39579                                  
 39580                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 39581                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 39582                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists

 39616                                  					; M049 - end

 39625                                  CreateFail:

 39627                                  
 39628                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 39629                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 39630                                  ;   serverdoscall.

 39650                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 39651                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39652                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 39653                                  ;	 BX= mode
 39654                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 39655                                  ;	 DX= flag
 39656                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 39657                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 39658                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 39659                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 39660                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 39661                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE

 39665                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened

 39874                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 39875                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39876                                  ;
 39877                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39878                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 39879                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 39880                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 39881                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 39882                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 39883                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 39884                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 39885                                  ;	    INT     21h
 39886                                  ;
 39887                                  ;   Error returns:
 39888                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 39889                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 39890                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 39891                                  ;
 39892                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39893                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 39894                                  ;
 39895                                  ;				    0? lock all
 39896                                  ;				    8? lock write
 39897                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 39898                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 39899                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 39900                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 39901                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 39902                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 39903                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 39904                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 39905                                  ;	    INT     21h
 39906                                  ;
 39907                                  ;   Error returns:
 39908                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 39909                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 39910                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 39911                                  ;
 39912                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 40122                                  ; LOCK_CHECK
 40123                                  ;MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 40124                                  
 40125                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40126                                  ; Inputs:
 40127                                  ;	Outputs of SETUP
 40128                                  ;	[USER_ID] Set
 40129                                  ;	[PROC_ID] Set
 40130                                  ; Function:
 40131                                  ;	Check for lock violations on local I/O
 40132                                  ;	Retries are attempted with sleeps in between
 40133                                  ; Outputs:
 40134                                  ;    Carry clear
 40135                                  ;	Operation is OK
 40136                                  ;    Carry set
 40137                                  ;	A lock violation detected
 40138                                  ; Outputs of SETUP preserved
 40139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40140                                  
 40141                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40142                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40143                                  LOCK_CHECK:
 40144 00007280 8B1E[1A00]              	MOV	BX,[RetryCount]	; Number retries
 40145                                  LockRetry:
 40146 00007284 53                      	push	bx		; save regs
 40147 00007285 50                      	push	ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 40148                                  
 40149                                  	;MSDOS 3.3
 40150                                  	;Call	far [ss:JShare+(8*4)]	; 8 = chk_block
 40151                                  	;MSDOS 6.0
 40152 00007286 FF1E[B000]              	Call	far [JShare+(8*4)]	; 8 = chk_block
 40153                                  
 40154 0000728A 58                      	pop	ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 40155 0000728B 5B                      	pop	bx		; restrore regs
 40156 0000728C 7307                    	jnc	short lc_ret_label ; There are no locks (retnc)
 40157                                  LockN:
 40158 0000728E E87A9F                  	call	Idle		; wait a while
 40159 00007291 4B                      	DEC	BX		; remember a retry
 40160 00007292 75F0                    	JNZ	short LockRetry	; more retries left...
 40161 00007294 F9                      	STC
 40162                                  lc_ret_label:
 40163 00007295 C3                      	retn

 40165                                  ; 14/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40166                                  ; LOCK_VIOLATION
 40167                                  ;MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 40168                                  
 40169                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40170                                  ; Inputs:
 40171                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 40172                                  ;	[READOP] indicates whether error on read or write
 40173                                  ; Function:
 40174                                  ;	Handle Lock violation on compatibility (FCB) mode SFTs
 40175                                  ; Outputs:
 40176                                  ;	Carry set if user says FAIL, causes error_lock_violation
 40177                                  ;	Carry clear if user wants a retry
 40178                                  ;
 40179                                  ; DS, ES, DI, CX preserved, others destroyed
 40180                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40181                                  
 40182                                  LOCK_VIOLATION:
 40183 00007296 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 40184 00007297 06                      	PUSH	ES
 40185 00007298 57                      	PUSH	DI
 40186 00007299 51                      	PUSH	CX
 40187                                  	;mov	ax,21h
 40188 0000729A B82100                  	MOV	AX,error_lock_violation

 40190 0000729D C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 40191 000072A2 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 40192 000072A6 BF0100                  	MOV	DI,1		; Fake some registers
 40193 000072A9 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 40194                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11]
 40195 000072AB 268B560B                	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 40196 000072AF E8D6DF                  	call	HARDERR
 40197 000072B2 59                      	POP	CX
 40198 000072B3 5F                      	POP	DI

 40227                                  ; SHARE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991

 40231                                  
 40232                                  ; SHARE_CHECK
 40233                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40234                                  ; Inputs:
 40235                                  ;       [THISSFT] Points to filled in local file/device SFT for new
 40236                                  ;               instance of file sf_mode ALWAYS has mode (even on FCB SFTs)
 40237                                  ;       [WFP_START] has full path of name
 40238                                  ;       [USER_ID] Set
 40239                                  ;       [PROC_ID] Set
 40240                                  ; Function:
 40241                                  ;       Check for sharing violations on local file/device access
 40242                                  ; Outputs:
 40243                                  ;    Carry clear
 40244                                  ;       Sharing approved
 40245                                  ;    Carry set
 40246                                  ;       A sharing violation detected
 40247                                  ;           AX is error code
 40248                                  ; USES    ALL but DS
 40249                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40250                                  
 40251                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40252                                  SHARE_CHECK:
 40253                                  	; 26/07/2019
 40254 000072C9 FF1E[9400]              	call	far [JShare+(1*4)] 	; 1 = MFT_Enter
 40255                                  shchk_retn:
 40256 000072CD C3                      	retn
 40257                                  
 40258                                  ; SHARE_VIOLATION
 40259                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40260                                  ; Inputs:
 40261                                  ;       [THISDPB] Set
 40262                                  ;       AX has error code
 40263                                  ; Function:
 40264                                  ;       Handle Sharing errors
 40265                                  ; Outputs:
 40266                                  ;       Carry set if user says FAIL, causes error_sharing_violation
 40267                                  ;       Carry clear if user wants a retry
 40268                                  ;
 40269                                  ; DS, ES, DI preserved, others destroyed
 40270                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40271                                  
 40272                                  SHARE_VIOLATION:
 40273 000072CE 1E                      	PUSH    DS
 40274 000072CF 06                      	PUSH	ES
 40275 000072D0 57                      	PUSH    DI
 40276 000072D1 C606[7505]00            	MOV     byte [READOP],0		; All share errors are reading
 40277                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 40278 000072D6 C606[4B03]18            	MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 40279 000072DB C42E[8A05]              	LES     BP,[THISDPB]
 40280 000072DF BF0100                  	MOV     DI,1			; Fake some registers
 40281 000072E2 89F9                    	MOV     CX,DI
 40282                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+17]
 40283 000072E4 268B5611                	MOV     DX,[ES:BP+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 40284 000072E8 E89DDF                  	call	HARDERR
 40285 000072EB 5F                      	POP     DI
 40286 000072EC 07                      	POP	ES
 40287 000072ED 1F                      	POP     DS
 40288 000072EE 3C01                    	CMP     AL,1
 40289 000072F0 74DB                    	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 40290 000072F2 F9                      	STC
 40291 000072F3 C3                      	retn
 40292                                  
 40293                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40294                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 40295                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 40296                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 40297                                  ;
 40298                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 40299                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 40300                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 40301                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40302                                  
 40303                                  ShareEnd:
 40304                                  	; 26/07/2019
 40305 000072F4 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 40306 000072F8 C3                      	retn
 40307                                  
 40308                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 40309                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40310                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 40311                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 40312                                  ;
 40313                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 40314                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 40315                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 40316                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 40317                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 40318                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40319                                  
 40320                                  ShareEnter:
 40321 000072F9 51                      	push	cx
 40322                                  retry:
 40323 000072FA 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 40324                                  attempt:
 40325 000072FE C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 40326 00007302 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 40327                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],axfff
 40328 00007304 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 40329 00007308 51                      	push	cx
 40330 00007309 E8BDFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 40331 0000730C 59                      	pop	cx
 40332 0000730D 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 40333 0000730F E8F99E                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 40334 00007312 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 40335 00007314 E8B7FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 40336 00007317 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 40337                                  done:
 40338 00007319 59                      	pop	cx
 40339 0000731A C3                      	retn
 40340

 40344                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0

 40346                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 40347                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40348                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 40349                                  ;
 40350                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 40351                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 40352                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 40353                                  ;
 40354                                  ;	Revision history:
 40355                                  ;
 40356                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 40357                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40358                                  
 40359                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40360                                  ;
 40361                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 40362                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 40363                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 40364                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 40365                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 40366                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 40367                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 40368                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 40369                                  ;
 40370                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40371                                  
 40372                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH

 40376

 40378                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H

 40381                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 40382

 40384                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2

 40386                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046

 40429 00007321 7413                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 40430

 40453                                  					; N: set up lie version first

 40458 00007341 E876ED                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 40459 00007344 E887ED                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 40460 00007347 5E                      	pop	si

 40470

 40488 0000736E E88E02                  	call	IsCopyProt		; check if copy protected
 40489 00007371 1F                      	pop	ds
 40490                                  
 40491                                  er_setA20:
 40492                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 40493                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 40494                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 40495                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 40496                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 40497                                  
 40498 00007372 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 40499 00007377 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 40500                                  					; turned OFF.
 40501                                  er_done:				; M068 - End

 40511                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40512                                  ;
 40513                                  ; procedure : Rational386Patch
 40514                                  ;
 40515                                  ; Older versions of the Rational DOS Extender have several bugs which trash
 40516                                  ; 386 registers (usually just the high word of 32 bit registers) during
 40517                                  ; interrupt processing. Lotus 123 3.1+ is a popular application that uses a
 40518                                  ; version of the Rational extender with the 32 bit register trashing bugs.
 40519                                  ;
 40520                                  ; This routine applies patches to the Rational DOS Extender to work around
 40521                                  ; most of the register trashing bugs.
 40522                                  ;
 40523                                  ; Note that there are additional register trashing bugs not fixed by these
 40524                                  ; patches. In particular, the high word of ESP and the FS and GS registers
 40525                                  ; may be modified on interrupts.
 40526                                  ;
 40527                                  ; There are two different Rational DOS Extender patchs in this module.
 40528                                  ; Rational386Patch is to correct 386 register trashing bugs on 386 or later
 40529                                  ; processors. This patch code is executed when MS-DOS is running on a 386
 40530                                  ; or later processor, regardless of whether MS-DOS is running in the HMA
 40531                                  ; or not.
 40532                                  ;
 40533                                  ; The other Rational patch routine (RationalPatch, below) fixes a register
 40534                                  ; trashing problem on 286 processors, and is only executed if MS-DOS is
 40535                                  ; running in the HMA.
 40536                                  ;
 40537                                  ; This patch detection and replacement is based on an example supplied by
 40538                                  ; Ben Williams at Rational.
 40539                                  ;
 40540                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40541                                  
 40542                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40543                                  ; DOSCODE:B448h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 40544                                  
 40545                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40546                                  ;
 40547                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 40548                                  ;
 40549                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40550                                  
 40551                                  rpFind1:
 40552                                  	db	0FAh, 0E4h, 21h, 60h, 33h, 0C0h, 0E6h, 43h, 8Bh, 16h
 40553                                  
 40554                                  rpFind1Len equ	$ - rpFind1
 40555                                  
 40556                                  ;	cli
 40557                                  ;	in	al, 21h
 40558                                  ;	pusha
 40559                                  ;	xor	ax, ax
 40560                                  ;	out	43h, al
 40561                                  ;	mov	dx, ...
 40562                                  
 40563                                  rpFind1a:
 40564                                  	db	0B0h, 0Eh, 0E6h, 37h, 33h, 0C0h, 0E6h, 0F2h
 40565                                  
 40566                                  rpFind1aLen equ	$ - rpFind1a
 40567                                  
 40568                                  ;	mov	al, 0Eh
 40569                                  ;	out	37h, al
 40570                                  ;	xor	ax, ax
 40571                                  ;	out	0F2h, al
 40572                                  
 40573                                  ; bug # 1 -- loss of high EAX on 386+ if not VCPI or DPMI
 40574                                  
 40575                                  rpFind2:
 40576                                  	db	0Fh, 20h, 0C0h
 40577                                  
 40578                                  rpFind2Len equ	$ - rpFind2
 40579                                  
 40580                                  ;	mov	eax, cr0	;may be preceeded by PUSH CX (51h)
 40581                                  
 40582                                  rpFind3:
 40583                                  	db	0Fh, 22h, 0C0h, 0EAh
 40584                                  
 40585                                  rpFind3Len equ	$ - rpFind3
 40586

 40588                                  ;	jmp	far ptr xxx	;change far ptr to go to replace3
 40589                                  ;	mov	ss, bx		;8E D3 ... and come back at or after this
 40590                                  
 40591                                  ; note, there is no rpRepl1 string
 40592

 40604                                  
 40605                                  rpRepl3Len equ	$ - rpRepl3
 40606                                  
 40607                                  ;	mov	ss, bx
 40608                                  ;	pop	cx
 40609                                  ;	pop	eax
 40610                                  
 40611                                  ; bug # 2 -- loss of high EAX and ESI on 386+ only if VCPI
 40612                                  
 40613                                  rpFind4:
 40614                                  	db	93h, 58h, 8Bh, 0CCh
 40615                                  
 40616                                  rpFind4Len equ	$ - rpFind4
 40617                                  
 40618                                  ;	xchg	bx, ax
 40619                                  ;	pop	ax
 40620                                  ;	mov	cx, sp

 40724                                  ; bug # 4 -- loss of high EAX and EBX on 386+ only if VCPI
 40725                                  
 40726                                  rpFind8:
 40727                                   	db	60h, 06h, 1Eh, 0B8h, 00h, 00h, 8Eh, 0D8h
 40728                                  
 40729                                  rpFind8Len equ	$ - rpFind8
 40730                                  
 40731                                  ;	pusha
 40732                                  ;	push	es
 40733                                  ;	push	ds
 40734                                  ;	mov	ax, dgroup	;jump back to here from replace8
 40735                                  ;	mov	ds, ax
 40736                                  
 40737                                  rpFind9 :
 40738                                  	db	1Fh, 07h, 61h
 40739                                  
 40740                                  rpFind9Len equ	$ - rpFind9
 40741                                  
 40742                                  ;	pop	ds
 40743                                  ;	pop	es
 40744                                  ;	popa
 40745                                  
 40746                                  rpRepl8:
 40747                                   	db	66h, 60h, 06h, 1Eh
 40748                                  
 40749                                  rpRepl8Len equ	$ - rpRepl8
 40750                                  
 40751                                  ;	pushad
 40752                                  ;	push	es
 40753                                  ;	push	ds
 40754                                  
 40755                                  rpRepl9:
 40756                                  	db	1Fh, 07h, 66h, 61h, 0C3h
 40757                                  
 40758                                  rpRepl9Len equ	$ - rpRepl9
 40759                                  
 40760                                  ;	pop	ds
 40761                                  ;	pop	es
 40762                                  ;	popad
 40763                                  ;	retn			;no need to jmp back to main-line
 40764                                  
 40765                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40766                                  
 40767                                  struc SearchPair
 40768                                   .sp_off1: resw 1	; offset of 1st search string
 40769                                   .sp_len1: resw 1	; length of 1st search string
 40770                                   .sp_off2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 40771                                   .sp_len2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 40772                                   .sp_diff: resw 1	; max difference between offsets
 40773                                   .size:
 40774                                  endstruc
 40775                                  
 40776                                  ;rpBug1Strs SearchPair	<offset rpFind2, rpFind2Len, offset rpFind3, rpFind3Len, 20h>
 40777                                  
 40778                                  rpBug1Strs:
 40779                                  	dw	rpFind2
 40780                                  	dw	rpFind2Len ; 3
 40781                                  	dw	rpFind3
 40782                                  	dw	rpFind3Len ; 4
 40783                                  	dw	20h
 40784

 40786

 40789                                  	dw	rpFind4Len ; 4
 40790                                  	dw	rpFind5
 40791                                  	dw	rpFind5Len ; 9
 40792                                  	dw	80h
 40793

 40795

 40797                                  	dw	rpFind6
 40798                                  	dw	rpFind6Len ; 3
 40799                                  	dw	rpFind7a
 40800                                  	dw	rpFind7aLen ; 7
 40801                                  	dw	80h
 40802                                  
 40803                                  ;rpBug4Strs SearchPair	<offset rpFind8, 4, offset rpFind9, rpFind9Len, 80h>
 40804

 40809                                  	dw	rpFind9Len ; 3

 40815                                   .sv_wVersion:	resw 1		; Rational extender version #
 40816                                   .sv_cbCodeSeg: resw 1		; code seg size to scan
