 44261                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 44262                                  ;============================================================================
 44263                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 44264                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 44265                                  
 44266                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 44267                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44268                                  
 44269                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 44270                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 44271                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 44272                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 44273                                  ;
 44274                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 44275                                  ; describing that data item.
 44276                                  
 44277                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 44278                                  
 44279                                  ;
 44280                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 44281                                  ;
 44282                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 44283                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 44284                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 44285                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 44286                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 44287                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 44288                                  ;
 44289                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 44290                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 44291                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 44292                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 44293                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 44294                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 44295                                  ;   as EOF).
 44296                                  
 44297                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 44298                                  
 44299                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 44300                                  
 44301                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 44302 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 44303 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 44304 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 44305                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 44306 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 44307                                  
 44308                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 44309                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 44310                                  ; console.
 44311                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 44312 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 44313 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 44314                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 44315 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 44316 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 44317                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 44318 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 44319 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 44320 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 44321                                  switch_character:
 44322 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 44323 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 44324 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 44325 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 44326 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name

 44524                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 44525                                  ;============================================================================
 44526                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 44527                                  
 44528                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 44529                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 44530                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 44531                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 44532                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 44533                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 44534                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 44535                                  ; **********************************************************
 44536                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 44537                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 44538                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 44539                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 44540                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 44541                                  ; **********************************************************	
 44542                                  
 44543                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 44544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44545                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 44546                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 44547                                  
 44548                                  ; 	ORG     0
 44549                                  
 44550                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 44551                                  
 44552                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 44553                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 44554 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 44555 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 44556                                  
 44557                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 44558                                  
 44559                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 44560                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 44561 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 44562                                  RENBUF:	
 44563 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 44564                                  
 44565                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 44566                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 44567 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 44568                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 44569 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 44570                                  
 44571                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 44572                                   
 44573                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 44574                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 44575                                  
 44576                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 44577                                  
 44578                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 44579                                  
 44580                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 44581                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 44582                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 44583                                  
 44584                                  NAME1:	
 44585 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 44586                                  NAME2:
 44587 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 44588                                  DESTSTART:
 44589 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 44590                                          ;DB      ((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 44591                                  	;times	5  db	0
 44592 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 44593                                  
 44594                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 44595                                  
 44596 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 44597                                  EXTFCB:	
 44598 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 44599                                  SATTRIB:
 44600 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 44601                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 44602 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 44603                                  FOUNDDEL:
 44604 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 44605                                  FOUND_DEV:
 44606 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 44607                                  FSPLICE:
 44608 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 44609                                  FSHARING:
 44610 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 44611                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 44612 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 44613 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 44614 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 44615                                  THISDRV:
 44616 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 44617                                  CLUSFAC:
 44618 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 44619                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 44620 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 44621                                  INSMODE:
 44622 00000579 00                      	db	0		; true => insert mode in buffered read
 44623 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 44624 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;
 44625                                  EXIT_TYPE:
 44626 0000057C 00                      	db	0		; type of exit...

 44629

 44631                                  
 44632                                  ; DOSDATA:057Eh
 44633                                  
 44634                                  ; WARNING - the following two items are accessed as a word
 44635                                  
 44636                                  CREATING:

 44638 0000057F 00                      DELALL:	db	0		; = 0 iff BUGBUG
 44639                                  				; = DIRFREE iff BUGBUG

 44992                                  
 44993                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 44994                                  
 44995                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44996                                  ;
 44997                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 44998                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 44999                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 45000                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 45001                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 45002                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45003                                  ; Example:
 45004                                  
 45005                                  MAP_CASE:
 45006                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 45007                                  
 45008 00000CF5 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 45009 00000CF7 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 45010 00000CF9 CB                      	RETF
 45011                                  Map1:
 45012 00000CFA 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 45013 00000CFC 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 45014 00000CFD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 45015 00000CFE BB[AF0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 45016                                  FINISH:
 45017 00000D01 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 45018 00000D02 1F                      	POP	DS
 45019 00000D03 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 45020 00000D04 5B                      	POP	BX
 45021 00000D05 1F                      	POP	DS
 45022                                  L_RET:	
 45023 00000D06 CB                      	RETF
 45024                                  
 45025                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 45026                                  
 45027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45028                                  
 45029                                  ; The variables for ECS version are moved here for the same data alignments
 45030                                  ; as IBM-DOS and MS-DOS.
 45031                                  
 45032                                  InterChar:
 45033 00000D07 00                      	db	0	; Interim character flag ( 1= interim)  ;AN000;
 45034                                  ;------- NOTE: NEXT TWO BYTES SOMETIMES USED AS A WORD !! -------------------
 45035                                  DUMMY:	; LABEL   WORD
 45036                                  InterCon:  
 45037 00000D08 00                      	db	0	; Console in Interim mode ( 1= interim) ;AN000;
 45038                                  SaveCurFlg:
 45039 00000D09 00                      	db	0	; Print, do not advance cursor flag     ;AN000;
 45040                                  
 45041                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45042                                  
 45043 00000D0A 0000                    TEMPSEG:  dw	0	;hkn; used to store ds.
 45044                                  redir_patch:
 45045 00000D0C 00                      	  db	0

 45051                                  ;IF2
 45052                                  ;	IF ((OFFSET MARK1) GT (OFFSET MSVERSION) )
 45053                                  ;		%OUT !DATA CORRUPTION!MARK1 OFFSET TOO BIG. RE-ORGANIZE DATA.
 45054                                  ;	ENDIF
 45055                                  ;ENDIF

 45060                                  ;
 45061                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 45062                                  ;

 45273                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 45274                                  ;
 45275                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 45276                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 45277                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 45278                                  ;
 45279                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 45280                                  ;
 45281                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 45282                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 45283                                  ;
 45284                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 45285                                  ;
 45286                                  ;############################################################################
 45287                                  
 45288                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 45289                                  
 45290                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45291                                  
 45292                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45293                                  ;
 45294                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 45295                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 45296                                  ;
 45297                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 45298                                  ;
 45299                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 45300                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 45301                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 45302                                  ;
 45303                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45304                                  
 45305                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 45306                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 45307                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 45308                                  ;ELSE
 45309                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 45310                                  ;ENDIF
 45311                                  ;ENDM

 45596                                  
 45597                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45598                                  ; 04/11/2022
 45599                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45600                                  
 45601                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45602                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 45603                                  ;
 45604                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the 
 45605                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data) 
 45606                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 45607                                  ;
 45608                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 45609                                  ;
 45610                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 45611                                  ;
 45612                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45613                                  
 45614                                  	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 45615                                  	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 45616                                  	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 45617                                  	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 45618                                  
 45619                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45620                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 45621                                  ;
 45622                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 45623                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in 
 45624                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 45625                                  ;
 45626                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45627                                  
 45628                                  	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 45629                                  	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 45630                                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 45631                                  
 45632                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022

 45689                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45690                                  ;
 45691                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 45692                                  ;
 45693                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts 
 45694                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the 
 45695                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 45696                                  ;
 45697                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 45698                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 45699                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 45700                                  ;	   4. else 
 45701                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 45702                                  ;	   6. endif
 45703                                  ;	7. else
 45704                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 45705                                  ;	9. endif
 45706                                  ;
 45707                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45708                                  
 45709                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45710                                  
 45711                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45712                                  
 45713                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45714                                  ;
 45715                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 45716                                  ;
 45717                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45718                                  
 45719                                  ldivov:
 45720                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45721                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45722                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45723                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45724                                  i0patch:
 45725 00001070 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont	
 45726                                  
 45727 00001072 E8E000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45728                                  divov_cont:
 45729 00001075 2EFF2E[4810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 45730                                  
 45731                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45732                                  ;
 45733                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 45734                                  ;
 45735                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 45736                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 45737                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 45738                                  ; will be restored then.
 45739                                  ;
 45740                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45741                                  
 45742                                  lquit:
 45743                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45744                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45745                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45746                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45747                                  i20patch:
 45748 0000107A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont	
 45749                                  
 45750 0000107C E8D600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45751                                  quit_cont:
 45752 0000107F 2EFF2E[4C10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 45753                                  
 45754                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45755                                  ;
 45756                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 45757                                  ;
 45758                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45759                                  
 45760                                  lcommand:
 45761                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45762                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45763                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45764                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45765                                  i21patch:
 45766 00001084 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont	
 45767                                  
 45768 00001086 E8CC00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45769                                  command_cont:
 45770 00001089 2EFF2E[5010]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 45771

 45773                                  ;
 45774                                  ; INT 25 
 45775                                  ;
 45776                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45777                                  
 45778                                  labsdrd:

 45780                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45781                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45782                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45783                                  i25patch:

 45787                                  absdrd_cont:

 45801                                  i26patch:

 45807

 45811                                  ;
 45812                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45813                                  
 45814                                  lstay_resident:

 45816                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is

 45818                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45819                                  i27patch:

 45829                                  ;

 45831                                  
 45832                                  lint2f:

 45834                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45835                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45836                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45837                                  i2fpatch:

 45841                                  int2f_cont:

 45843

 45845                                  ;
 45846                                  ; CPM entry
 45847                                  ;
 45848                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45849                                  
 45850                                  lcall_entry:
 45851                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45852                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45853                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45854                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45855                                  cpmpatch:
 45856 000010B6 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont	
 45857                                  
 45858 000010B8 E89A00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45859                                  callentry_cont:
 45860 000010BB 2EFF2E[6410]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 45861                                  
 45862                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45863                                  
 45864                                  lirett:
 45865 000010C0 CF                      	iret
 45866                                  
 45867                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45868                                  ;
 45869                                  ; LowIntXX:
 45870                                  ;
 45871                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 45872                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 45873                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 45874                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 45875                                  ;
 45876                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 45877                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 45878                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 45879                                  ;
 45880                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 45881                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 45882                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 45883                                  ;
 45884                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45885                                  
 45886 000010C1 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 45887 000010C5 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 45888 000010C9 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 45889                                  
 45890                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 45891                                  LowInt23:
 45892                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45893                                  					; the stack
 45894 000010CD 2E8F06[C110]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 45895 000010D2 2E8F06[C310]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 45896                                  
 45897 000010D7 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 45898                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45899                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45900                                  
 45901 000010D9 E87900                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 45902                                  
 45903 000010DC 2EFF2E[C110]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 45904                                  
 45905                                  
 45906                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 45907                                  LowInt24:
 45908                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45909                                  					; the stack
 45910 000010E1 2E8F06[C510]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 45911 000010E6 2E8F06[C710]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 45912                                  
 45913 000010EB CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 45914                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45915                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45916                                  
 45917 000010ED E86500                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45918                                  
 45919 000010F0 2EFF2E[C510]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 45920                                  
 45921                                  
 45922                                   
 45923                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 45924                                  LowInt28:
 45925 000010F5 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 45926                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45927                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45928                                  
 45929 000010F7 E85B00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45930                                  
 45931 000010FA CB                      	retf
 45932                                  
 45933                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45934                                  
 45935                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45936                                  ;
 45937                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 45938                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 45939                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 45940                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 45941                                  ;
 45942                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 45943                                  
 45944                                  disa20_xfer:
 45945 000010FB E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 45946                                  
 45947                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 45948                                  
 45949                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 45950                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 45951                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 45952                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 45953                                  
 45954 000010FE FA                      	cli
 45955 000010FF 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 45956                                  
 45957 00001105 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 45958 00001107 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 45959 00001109 FB                      	sti
 45960                                  
 45961 0000110A 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 45962 0000110B 56                      	push	SI
 45963 0000110C 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 45964 0000110E 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 45965 00001110 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 45966 00001112 CB                      	retf
 45967                                  
 45968                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45969                                  ;
 45970                                  ; M003:
 45971                                  ;
 45972                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 45973                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning 
 45974                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 45975                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for 
 45976                                  ; more info.	
 45977                                  ;
 45978                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that 
 45979                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's 
 45980                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 45981                                  ;
 45982                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45983                                  
 45984                                  disa20_iret:
 45985 00001113 E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 45986 00001116 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 45987 0000111A 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 45988 0000111E 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 45989 00001122 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 45990                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 45991 00001124 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 45992 00001127 A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 45993 0000112A A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 45994 0000112D A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 45995 00001130 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 45996                                  
 45997 00001133 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 45998 00001134 5B                      	pop	BX
 45999 00001135 59                      	pop	CX
 46000 00001136 5A                      	pop	DX
 46001 00001137 5E                      	pop	SI
 46002 00001138 5F                      	pop	DI
 46003 00001139 5D                      	pop	BP
 46004 0000113A 1F                      	pop	DS
 46005 0000113B 07                      	pop	ES
 46006 0000113C CF                      	iret
 46007                                  
 46008                                  ;**************************************************************************
 46009                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line			      
 46010                                  ;									      
 46011                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in 	      
 46012                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 46013                                  ;									      
 46014                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA				      
 46015                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled					      
 46016                                  ;	USES	NOTHING					      
 46017                                  ;									      
 46018                                  ;**************************************************************************
 46019                                  
 46020                                  XMMDisableA20:
 46021 0000113D 53                      	push	bx
 46022 0000113E 50                      	push	ax
 46023                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 46024 0000113F B406                    	mov	ah,6
 46025 00001141 2EFF1E[4911]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 46026 00001146 58                      	pop	ax
 46027 00001147 5B                      	pop	bx
 46028 00001148 C3                      	retn
 46029                                  
 46030                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 46031                                  
 46032                                  XMMcontrol:
 46033 00001149 00000000                	dd	0
 46034                                  
 46035                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46036                                  ;
 46037                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 46038                                  ;									      
 46039                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in		 	      
 46040                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 46041                                  ;									      
 46042                                  ;	ENTRY: none		
 46043                                  ;
 46044                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 46045                                  ;		
 46046                                  ; 	USES : NONE								      
 46047                                  ;									      
 46048                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46049                                  
 46050                                  LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 46051 0000114D 8000                    	dw	00080h
 46052 0000114F 0000                    	dw	00000h
 46053                                  
 46054                                  HighMemory:	; label dword
 46055 00001151 9000                    	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 46056 00001153 FFFF                    	dw	0FFFFh
 46057                                  
 46058                                  EnsureA20ON:
 46059 00001155 9C                      	pushf
 46060 00001156 1E                      	push    ds
 46061 00001157 06                      	push	es
 46062 00001158 51                      	push	cx
 46063 00001159 56                      	push	si
 46064 0000115A 57                      	push	di
 46065                                  
 46066 0000115B 2EC536[4D11]            	lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 46067 00001160 2EC43E[5111]            	les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 46068 00001165 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 46069 00001168 FC                      	cld
 46070 00001169 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 46071                                  
 46072 0000116B 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 46073                                  EA20_RET:
 46074 0000116D 5F                      	pop	di
 46075 0000116E 5E                      	pop	si
 46076 0000116F 59                      	pop	cx
 46077 00001170 07                      	pop	es
 46078 00001171 1F                      	pop	ds
 46079 00001172 9D                      	popf
 46080 00001173 C3                      	retn
 46081                                  
 46082                                  EA20_OFF:
 46083                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 46084                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 46085                                  
 46086 00001174 53                      	push	bx
 46087 00001175 50                      	push	ax
 46088                                  
 46089 00001176 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 46090 00001178 2EA3[6C10]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 46091 0000117C 2E8926[6E10]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 46092 00001181 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 46093 00001183 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 46094 00001185 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 46095                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 46096                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 46097 00001188 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 46098 0000118A 2EFF1E[4911]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 46099 0000118F 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 46100 00001191 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 46101                                  
 46102 00001193 2EA1[6C10]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 46103 00001197 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 46104 00001199 2E8B26[6E10]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 46105                                  
 46106 0000119E 58                      	pop	ax
 46107 0000119F 5B                      	pop	bx
 46108                                  
 46109 000011A0 EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 46110                                  
 46111                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 46112 000011A2 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 46113 000011A4 CD10                    	int	10h
 46114 000011A6 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 46115 000011A8 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 46116 000011AA 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 46117 000011AC B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 46118 000011AE CD10                    	int	10h
 46119                                  XMMcont:
 46120 000011B0 B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 46121 000011B2 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 46122 000011B4 CD10                    	int	10h
 46123                                  	
 46124 000011B6 BE[9312]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 46125 000011B9 0E                      	push	cs
 46126 000011BA 1F                      	pop	ds
 46127 000011BB FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 46128                                  XMMprnt:
 46129 000011BC AC                      	lodsb
 46130 000011BD 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 46131 000011BF 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 46132 000011C1 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 46133 000011C3 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 46134 000011C6 CD10                    	int	10h
 46135 000011C8 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 46136                                  
 46137                                  XMMStall:
 46138 000011CA FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 46139 000011CB EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 46140

 46224                                  ;
 46225                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 46226                                  ;
 46227                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 46228                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 46229                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 46230                                  ;
 46231                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 46232                                  ;
 46233                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 46234                                  ;
 46235                                  ;############################################################################
 46236                                   
 46237                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 46238                                  
 46239                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46240                                  
 46241                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 46242                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 46243                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 46244                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 46245                                  
 46246                                  ; country and code page information
 46247                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46248                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 46249 00001205 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 46250 0000120D 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 46250 00001216 53595300           
 46251                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 46252 0000121A 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 46253                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 46254                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 46255                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 46256                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 46257                                  ;  endif
 46258                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 46259                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 46260                                  ;  endif
 46261                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 46262                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 46263                                  ;  endif
 46264                                  ;else
 46265 0000124D B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 46266                                  ;endif
 46267                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 46268 0000124F 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 46269 00001251 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 46270 00001252 [AD0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 46271 00001254 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 46272 00001256 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 46273 00001257 [2F0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 46274 00001259 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 46275 0000125B 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 46276 0000125C [B10B]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 46277 0000125E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 46278 00001260 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 46279 00001261 [E10B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 46280 00001263 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 46281 00001265 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 46282 00001266 [E30C]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 46283 00001268 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 46284 0000126A 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 46285 0000126B 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 46286                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 46287                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 46288                                  ;	...... 
 46289                                  ;else

 46294 00001278 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator

 46302 00001285 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point

 46457                                  
 46458                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 46459                                  ;
 46460                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 46461                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.

 46500                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 46501                                  
 46502                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 46503                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 46504                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 46505                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 46506                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 46507                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 46508                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 46509                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 46510                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 46511                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 46512                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 46513                                  			db	009H,003H
 46514                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 46515                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 46516                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 46517                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 46518                                  			db	05FH
 46519                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 46520                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 46521                                  
 46522                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 46523                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 46524                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 46525                                  
 46526                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 46527                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 46528                                  ;
 46529                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 46530                                  ;
 46531                                  ;
 46532                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 46533                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 46534                                  ;	    je l1
 46535                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 46536                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 46537                                  ;	    int 10h
 46538                                  ;	    jmp l0
 46539                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 46540                                  
 46541                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 46542                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 46543                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 46544                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 46545                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 46546                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 46547                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 46548                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 46549                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 46550                                  
 46551                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46552                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46553                                  
 46554                                  ; 06/12/2022
 46555                                  ;DOSDATASIZE	equ  $ - DOSDATASTART ; 4962 bytes (1362h)
 46556                                  
 46557                                  ; DOSDATA ends
 46558                                  
 46559                                  ;============================================================================
 46560                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 46561                                  ;============================================================================
 46562                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 46563                                  
 46564                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 46565                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 46566                                  ;
 46567                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 46568                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 46569                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 46570                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 46571                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 46572                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 46573                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 46574                                  ; to call out here.
 46575                                  ;
 46576                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 46577                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 46578                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 46579                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 46580                                  ;       
 46581                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 46582                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 46583                                  ;
 46584                                  ;Exported Functions
 46585                                  ;==================
 46586                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 46587                                  
 46588                                  ; DosData Segment
 46589                                  
 46590                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46591                                  
 46592                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46593                                  
 46594                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 46595                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 46596                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 46597                                  ; 'patch' related.
 46598                                  
 46599                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 46600                                  	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 46601                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46602                                  
 46603                                  MagicPatch:
 46604                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 46605                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 46606                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 46607                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 46608                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 46609                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 46610                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 46611                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 46612                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 46613                                  
 46614                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46615                                  
 46616                                  ;DosData Ends
 46617                                  
 46618                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 46619                                  
 46620                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46621                                  
 46622                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 46623                                  
 46624                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46625                                  
 46626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46627                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 46628                                  
 46629                                  db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 46630                                  
 46631                                  ;align 16
 46632                                  
 46633                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 46634                                  
 46635                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46636                                  
 46637                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
 46638                                  
 46639                                  ; 05/12/2022
 46640                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 46641                                  
 46642                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46643                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 46644                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 46645                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART
